dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very late. All is quiet. Then a battered MINI-VAN blows b a row of hedges that have been pruned to read: 'WELCOME T CAPE COD.' A moment later a FLASHING COP CAR flies by in PURSUIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WINDSHIELD IS GONE and the wind blows back the hair o two BEAT-UP-LOOKING MEN. The driver, FRED SEARING, 40-ish has a look of determination and resolve on his chunky fac despite the BLACK EYE and BLOOD-STAINED TISSUE dangling o of his nose. The nervous passenger is RICK MILLS, 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, I can out-run 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you can't--not in this thing! Another POLICE CRUISER FISHTAILS OUT OF A SIDE STREET and JOINS THE CHASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, now there's two of 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care--I'm not stopping 'til we get there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm crazy! I'm crazy about my wife!

dialogues.speaker: A CAPE COD HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: Rick and Fred come SKIDDING UP to the EMERGENCY ENTRANCE followed by the two police cruisers. When they stop, we s that somebody has spray-painted 'HORNY OLD MAN' on the si of the mini-van. Fred jumps out and SPRINTS toward the entrance. SEVERAL C spring from their cars and give chase. Before Fred can re the front doors, he gets KNOCKED VIOLENTLY to the ground. Rick climbs out of the passenger seat with HIS HANDS RAIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear me out, gentlemen, I can explain every--! AS A BURLY OFFICER'S HEAD CONNECTS WITH RICK'S CHEST, we.
.And FADE TO BLACK... and then:

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: Law & Order MUSIC CUE as we SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TV SCREEN - a video shows several YOUNG PEOPLE, early- 20's, sunning themselves at the beach. A YOUNG-LOOKING RI hams it up for the camera.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: See the stud in the blue shorts? That's me the summer I got out of college.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Wow, Dad, you used to have muscles. REVERSE ANGLE reveals EMMA, 6, and GUNNAR, 4, sitting on either side of Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still have a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Rick shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're hidden. BACK ON TV SCREEN - A PRETTY GIRL with a knockout body co up and puts her arms around Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean the young one standing next to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy used to have long hair? And she wore a bikini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come she doesn't wear a bikini anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it because of her fat ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. What? No. Who said Mommy's got a fat ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy. LONG BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh, I don't appreciate that language, Gunnar. You've got the best mom in the whole world--don't ever say anything bad about her. Just then, MAGGIE comes GRUNTING into the room carrying a YEAR-OLD BABY in one arm and a basket of laundry in the other. She's in her late-30's, cute, with short, manageab mommy hair. She's wearing SWEATPANTS, an OVERSIZED T-SHIR and NO MAKE-UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey beautiful, you better get a move on--we're supposed to be meeting Fred and Grace soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know, I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well how long you gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-five minutes--sooner if you help with the kids. Maggie looks to him, hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-five minutes is good. Maggie shoots him a look and Rick smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kidding. Okay, kids, first one in the tub gets college paid for. Emma and Gunnar just stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you bums, let's go!
As Rick starts to tickle his kids they run out of the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Maggie walk along hand-in-hand. They're dressed- and happy-looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss going out with you on Saturday nights. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's just like the old days. Rick pulls Maggie close as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should make a rule that we go out at least six nights a week without the kids. Maggie GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. We should go out every week--just you and me. A BEAUTIFUL BLONDE walks past them and Rick gives a QUICK GLANCE back AT HER ASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it'd be healthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me? Maggie pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just checked out that girl's butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you did, and it's rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You think she saw me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, yeah. I'm sorry, honey, I'm just kind of spacey today.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on, we're late! REVERSE ANGLE reveals Fred Searing and his wife GRACE, 38 waiting outside a restaurant. Fred sports a full-head of hair that's maybe a little too stiff. Grace is short and appealing in a Rachel Ray kind of way. Fred leans in to k Maggie as Rick kisses Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, let me ask you something: Does Fred ever check out other women in front of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Fred's not a gawker. Grace pats a pleased-looking Fred on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mags, let's go say hi to Dr. Lucy. We follow the women as they leave their husbands and ENTE the restaurant under a banner that says, 'Boston Psychiat Association Person of the Year.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Maggie approach the check-in table.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: There they are! ANOTHER ANGLE reveals DR. LUCY GILBERT, a very attractive sophisticated-looking 40-year-old, holding court in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Lucy! Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: Girls, thank you so much for coming. Dr. Lucy speaks with a FRENCH ACCENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? You're the only friend of ours who ever got an award--you think we're going to miss that? ANGLE ON Rick and Fred standing at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind telling me how your wife catches you checking out another girl? What is this, amateur hour?
The BARTENDER delivers a couple beers and Rick pays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl walked past and I glanced back at her for like half a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your problem, dumb-ass-- it's the wrong order. You don't wait for the girl to walk past and then glance back. You turn when she's still fifteen feet in front of you...then you wait for her to walk into your line of vision. Fred NOTICES an ATTRACTIVE WOMAN walking toward them from right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Observe. Before the woman reaches them, Fred turns to his left and holds the look until the Attractive Woman's ASS ENTERS HI VIEW and he watches her walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? I can't help it if her butt walks where I'm already looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was your air space.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. They turn to see a BEAUTIFUL WOMAN with a healthy tan wal past carrying several drinks. This is MISSY FRANKENFIELD, mid-30's.

dialogues.speaker: RICK AND FRED
dialogues.text: Hey, Missy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CALLING back to them) Don't forget to mingle! The guys watch Missy walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Missy's looking pretty good for someone going through a divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's rough stuff--I heard they might have to sell the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. You gonna hit 'em up for the listing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I, a vulture? Nah, I don't go after the divorcee business unless they approach me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's kind of tacky, huh? As the guys crane their necks to get a better view of Mis ass, we... REVERSE ANGLE to reveal Maggie, Grace and Dr. Lucy sippin lemondrops and watching Rick and Fred from across the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at those two meatheads checking out Missy Frankenfield. What, do they think they're invisible over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said Fred wasn't a gawker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was standing right next to you. I can't let him know that I know-- that would take all the fun out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see him. He's got some stupid move where he looks back before the girl passes to make it seem like he couldn't help but notice her ass. It's pathetic. Maggie and Dr. Lucy GIGGLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's car is parked in the driveway, and he and Maggie a getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about I drive the babysitter home while you go upstairs and prepare the altar? He puts his arm around her as they walk toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to, honey, but I've got to get up early with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get up with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to go out and buy a gift- -they're going to a birthday party tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll cjet the gift, then I'll take the kids to the park, then to the party. You can dust stay in bed,, get your beauty sleep, and bask in the sweet, sweet pounding I'm about to give you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it when you sweet-talk me. Maggie smiles but as Rick opens the front door they FREEZ THEIR TRACKS. THEIR POV - the babysitter (PAIGE, 20, cute) is standing there with their 4-year-old, Gunnar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy! Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little buddy.. .what are you doing up? Gunnar runs into his mother's arms and Maggie shrugs apologetically to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just a minor obstacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is at the wheel of his Dodge Caravan and Paige sits the passenger seat. She is on the busty side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How were the kids tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. That Gunnar is so cute-- all he wants to do is wrestle with me. Rick smiles at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mills, would it be okay to turn down the air--I'm a little chilly. Look--I got goose bumps. As she HOLDS OUT HER ARM to show him the GOOSE-BUMPS, we RACK FOCUS BEYOND HER ARM to the ERECT NIPPLES that are PIERCING THROUGH HER SHEER TOP like small tents. BACK ON Rick as his EYES GO WIDE WITH TERROR and he looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, sure, I'm sorry. Flustered, he moves to the temperature control which in L ILLUMINATED DIGITAL TYPE reads: 69!!! He quickly PUNCHES A/C OFF, then trains his eyes straight ahead and grips th steering wheel tight at ten-and-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mini-van pulls up in front of a sorority house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige hesitates before getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mills, can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .could you buy me some beer? Rick looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy you some.. .How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty. But I'm turning twenty-one next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Happy birthday. That's a biggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. My aunt usually buys beer for me, but she's out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. . .could ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I don't know, Paige...I could get in a lot of trouble for giving alcohol to a minor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, I'm a junior in college. You drank when you were in college, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, it's so arbitrary. How does it make sense that twenty's old enough to fight in Iraq or watch a porno movie, but it's too young to drink a beer? Rick shifts in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Twenty's old enough to uh...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight in Iraq?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the other thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch Porn? Oh, God yeah--half the girls in those things are my age. Rick catches a hint of cleavage, a flash of leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I promise no one's gonna find out. If you want, you can join me down at the lake--we'll listen to some tunes and have a couple beers. Rick stares at her, pictures it in his head. She looks hopeful, open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Paige, I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... it would be.. .inappropriate. Rick's voice has taken on a firmer, more adult tone. Paig seems amused by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, is that your grown-up voice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be inappropriate, Paige.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Paige. (with an edge) What are you thinking? I'm a married man and I have a family. You think they'd like it if they knew I was hanging out at the lake, all alone, drinking beer with a college girl?
She seems taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said alone. My sorority's having a party down there tonight. Rick CLEARS HIS THROAT, tries to hide his embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, better get inside. She opens the car door, then glares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ewww. What the hell were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Scoot along now. As she SLAMS the car door, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick bounds up the stairs to find Maggie gently closing Gunnar's bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. He just fell asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome. Rick playfully pinches Maggie's butt as he follows her in their bedroom where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .They find Emma sitting up in their bed, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I sleep with you tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Absolutely not. Maggie, clearly softening to the idea, shrugs at Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious? Look, besides the other thing, I don't like the fact that my daughter needs someone to sleep with every night--that's not going to be good when she goes off to college, you know. Maggie rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.. .can someone read me a story? Rick looks at Maggie, then at his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, one quick story. Come on, jump on my back. Emma jumps on Rick's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get started without me-- I'll be right back. Rick piggybacks Emma out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is putting Rick's HAIR INTO PONYTAILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, honey, this is the last pony and then night-night. Emma finishes putting on a rubberband, then looks at him, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. You look pretty, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now give me a kiss, hug and go to sleep. She lays back on her pillow. Rick gives her a big kiss on both cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick (still in ponytails) tip-toes out of Emma's bedroom, closes the door so tly, then HUSTLES DOWN THE HALLWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RICK & MAGGIE'S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Rick scrambles into the room and STOPS IN HIS TRACKS.
HIS POV - Maggie lays in bed, FAST ASLEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Please, no. Rick wants to wake her up but sees that she needs the sle so he just PULLS THE COVERS OVER HER SHOULDERS. As Rick walks around the bed and INTO THE BATHROOM in the b.g., we HOLD ON MAGGIE until she OPENS HER EYES. She listens to her husband brush his teeth with perhaps a tin of GUILT, and when he shuts off the faucet, she CLOSES HE EYES AGAIN, and we...

dialogues.text: Rick pushes Gunnar and Emma on the swings as a sweaty Fre APPROACHES carrying a tennis racket. (We see several TENN COURTS in the b.g.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So'd you get the business? Fred nods and wipes his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty sure I got the Auto and Home. He told me to call his accountant on Monday about the Life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Fred looks around at all the pretty MOMS and NANNIES with their CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. They NOTICE something O.S.. THEIR POV - we see a SCANDINAVIAN AU PAIR bent over EXPOS HER THONG UNDERWEAR as she picks up a CHILD from a wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.
Rick SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CPR girl's back, too. Rick nods toward A PIG-TAILED PARAMEDIC, early 30's, TEAC A CPR CLASS. The two men look on solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine if we were coming here back when we were single?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby, the damage we would do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me first! Rick trails them like a Sherpa carrying a couple Razor scooters and a basketball as Fred tags along. They shlep past THE TRI-DELTA SORORITY playing ultimate frisbee and WEARING 'JUICY' SWEATS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you get lucky last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, the kids were up when we got home. How 'bout you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, kinda lucky. Grace conked right out so I snuck out to the car and rubbed one out. Rick shoots Fred a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car? What are you Knight Rider? Why didn't you just go in the bathroom like a normal guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And get caught by Grace? Can't risk it. Besides, cars turn me on--it's where I lost my virginity. And they're comfy--I just put the seat back and turn on the tunes. The guys sit on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one of the things they don't tell you when you're young--that you'll still be jerking-off after you get married. I thought it was dust gonna be a teenage thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I didn't see that one coming. The two men sit in silence for a LONG BEAT as the Frisbee Girls play all around them. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I miss the most? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know when you're taking a girl's panties off for the first time, and you're wondering if she's going to stop you, but then she gives you that little pelvic arch- thrust that tells you that the struggle's over, everything's going to be okay? Rick SIGHS. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a happy moment. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Another thing gone forever. Rick looks at his watch. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should get going, I have to drop the kids off at a birthday party. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to grab a coffee after? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any interest in going down to the Patriot's training camp one of these days? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding, I'd love that. Except...I always feel kind of pathetic waiting in line for Tom Brady's autograph.
RICK

dialogues.text: Fred, I was planning on bringing the kids. FRED

dialogues.text: Uh-oh... HIS POV - SLO-MO of a BEAUTIFUL GIRL walking toward him. straight brown hair shimmers.. .her blue eyes twinkle.. . white uniformed blouse is unbuttoned enough to reveal a tasteful amount of CLEAVAGE. This is COFFEE GIRL, 23, granola, fresh, Australian, spacey. BACK ON THE GUYS staring in awe. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chanting, scared) Please don't have a nice ass, please don't have a nice ass... But as she turns to pour a cup of coffee, we see that HER IS SPECTACULAR. Rick turns away, annoyed. RICK (CONT'D

dialogues.text: Oh, come on! That's ri iculous. FRED

ANOTHER ANGLE reveals a WANNABE ARTIST-TYPE MALE EMPLOYEE mid-20's (clearly covetous of Coffee Girl) sizing Rick an Fred up as he wipes down a counter.

dialogues.text: COFFEE GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd go with the bran muffin--you guys are probably having digestive issues at your age, right? Rick flinches at this, then turns to Coffee Girl. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Rick and Fred, now with coffees, sit at the rear of the s RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Say cheese.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, guys, give it a rest.
Rick and Fred turn to see ED LONG, tall, good-looking, mi 40's, standing at the creamer counter behind them. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Ed. Didn't see you there. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because you were shooting laser beams at the java babe. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, we were just-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, gentlemen, you're married men and she's half your age--grow P-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys can't muster a response. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess I'll be seeing you at the house-warming party this weekend. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm? ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Saturday afternoon at the new casa--we're inally in and we're having a little celebration. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know if we can-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wives already RSVP'd. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Til then. Ed HOLDS OUT HIS FIST to them. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, pound the potato. Rick and Fred reluctantly take turns TAPPING Ed's fist wi theirs. Then Ed leaves. FRED (UNDER BREATH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a d-bag. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right though. Fred looks at Rick.
RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing sitting here gawking at her for? We're married men--it's creepy. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see what the big deal is-- we're not hurting anyone. What is he Big Brother--he's gonna tell me what I can look at now? For God sakes, don't take that away from me- -it's all I got! As Rick thinks about this, we... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A BABY MONITOR - PULL BACK to reveal that it's i the middle of a POKER TABLE next to a pile of ONE-DOLLAR BILLS. Sitting around the table PLAYING LIAR'S POKER are Rick, Fred, GARY, HOG-HEAD, BAKER, and FLATS, all in thei mid-30's to mid-40's. Hog-head has a huge melon, Baker is husky, Flats is a pale red-head, and Gary is slight and squirrelly. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, you open. Rick takes a fresh DOLLAR BILL off the pile in front of h and STUDIES THE SERIAL NUMBERS. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four 9's. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where's Coakley? How come he didn't show? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vegas. Hawaiian Tropic finals. The guys nod their approval. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, imagine being Coakley? The guy's single, he's loaded, chicks love him, he doesn't have to answer to anybody. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the life. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the life. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something: What would you guys pay to have your way with a Hawaiian Tropic girl for an entire weekend? The guys perk up as they think about this.
HOG-HEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get to pick any one you want-- and you know up front that you won't get her pregnant, no diseases, you're never gonna hear from her again, and your wife will never find out. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it possible to know that my wife won't find out? HOG-HEAD (ANNOYED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not. I'm saying if it were possible, like if I was a magic genie and I could grant you this wish but then make it like it never even happened. FLATS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But would I still have memory of it? HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Great memories. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oof. I think I'd pay 500 bucks for that. Baker shoots him a look. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cheap,bastard. We're talking about an investment that gets your rocks off and protects your wife's feelings. I'd pay five grand. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, excuse me, Mr. Wall Street, but us public school teachers aren't getting any of that bail-out money you're over-tipping everyone with. Just then, the front door OPENS and Maggie ENTERS. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, honey. How was the book club? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you guys read this month?
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hemingway. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Man and the Sea? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Muriel's yoga book. The guys LAUGH. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, we were supposed to be discussing The Sun Also Rises but Grace pulled out a bottle of tequila and that was the end of that. So, did the kids go down easy? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunnar and Emma stalled for a while, but they weren't bad. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the baby? Rick points to the BABY MONITOR in the middle of the tabl RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a peep. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great job. Now win some money, honey. She kisses Rick and walks out of the room. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could drink tequila. It's a great buzz but it always gives me the spins and then I have to go home early. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know a sure cure for the spins? Fred puts a hand over his right eye. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just cover up one eye. It balances out the equilibrium. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you could find a nice 12-step program. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maggie gets to the top of the stairs, she can hear the O.S. SOUND OF THE BABY CRYING. She walks down the hall, opens the Baby's door and REACTS. HER POV - the exhausted and sweaty Baby is standing in hi crib, SOBBING. The baby monitor is on the dresser next to the crib BLARING out LAUGHTER from the poker game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you poor thing... She hurries to the Baby and PICKS HIM UP. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly Daddy... he got the monitors mixed-up. Have you been listening to those loud-mouths all night? As Maggie moves to turn off the monitor, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: FLATS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: .So how 'bout you, Fred--how much would you pay to s end an entire weekend with one of the hottest women in the world? Maggie hesitates and LISTENS IN.

dialogues.speaker: FRED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have to pay--I'm married to her. There's a BEAT, then the guys EXPLODE IN LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: FRED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No, seriously, I'd pay five grand, easy. Maggie's JAW DROPS.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON POKER GAME
dialogues.text: FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have to figure out a way to get it out of the bank without Grace noticing, but I suppose the genie could help me with that. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could put me down for seven- five. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pfttt. Hog-head, your ass doesn't have seven-five. More LAUGHTER from the guys as Rick deals out fresh bills
FLATS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your number, Rick? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh jeez, Flats, I don't know... FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.. any girl you choose. You get to do anything you want with her, and your wife will never find out. It's completely harmless, a one-time thing--what would you pay for that? BACK ON MAGGIE as she cradles her baby and LEANS CLOSER t the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I honestly don't know, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ballpark. PUSH IN ON MAGGIE as she waits nervously for her husband' answer.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Well... I've got a great wife and I sure wouldn't want to hurt her feelings, so... Maggie SMILES at this. That's my guy!

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I guess the real question is, what wouldn't I pay?! The guys LAUGH O.S. and MAGGIE REACTS, as we... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie's got Rick backed into a corner. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What wouldn't you pay?! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't really mean it, honey. (scared, defenseless) They kind of put me on the spot. Look, some of the other guys were throwing out some pretty hefty bids. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with anything? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'm the host of the party, I didn't want to be a buzz-kill.     24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie squints, appalled. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, all I was saying was, there's no amount of money I wouldn't pay to protect you and the kids. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is having sex with a hooker protecting me and the kids? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one said anything about hookers. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were paying for sex--what would you call her? RICK (WEAKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.. .the genie was getting the dough, not her. (RECOVERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, be reasonable, it was just guy-talk--it's not like it could really happen. Maggie shakes her head, disgusted, and leaves the room. RICK (CONT'D) (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, Grace, and Dr. Lucy eat at an upscale restaurant. Dr. Lucy listens quietly to the women. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred said five grand? What a blowhard! MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what's even funnier? Hog- head McCormick said he'd pay seven grand. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! That bum hasn't worked since the dot-com bust--his wife supports him! The girls LAUGH. GRACE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look on the bright side: At least they're not cheating on us. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder if it would be better if they did cheat and get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: You mean, rather than take the slow boat to resentment? The girls look to Dr. Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: I'm just saying.. .maybe a little freedom would be good for them. And for you. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever considered giving them a hall pass? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: A hall pass. A week off from marriage. Grace and Maggie stop chewing. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. . .Are you saying let them go out and cheat?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: I'm saying give them a week off from marriage. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, most married men have foggy memories of their single days and they somehow get under the impression that if not for you, they'd be able to be with ail those women who entice them. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Fred. He thinks because he sees big tits everywhere and then still comes home for dinner that I should be welcoming him at the door like some conquering hero. Dr. Lucy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: Well, maybe it's time to let them go out there and find out what it's really like. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You're talking about the nuclear option. Maggie ponders the idea. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And remind me again, what good could possibly come from this...?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: There's a wonderful principle in psychology called 'reactance theory.' It basically states that if you're constantly told you can't do something, you want to do it more than ever. And conversely, if you remove the taboo, you remove the obsession. Grace makes a 't' sound. GRACE (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an idea, Doc: Why don't you try a hall pass out on your husband and let us know how it works out.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh, I have. Grace and Maggie REACT to this. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling us you let Charlie sleep with another woman? Dr. Lucy takes a moment before answering.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: I am not telling you that. I am telling you that I gave him the freedom to choose for himself. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUCY
dialogues.text: All I know is...our marriage is better than ever. Grace and Maggie think about this. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. There's a reason that men evolved and apes didn't. It's because women demanded more. Without a wife, Einstein would've been humping a maple tree all day. As the women LAUGH, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ED & KIMMY LONG'S ESTATE - DAY There are several flashy cars out front of this huge McMansion. As Fred and Grace and Rick and Maggie get out Fred's mini-van, Ed Long comes out of the house to greet them. (Ed's 5-YEAR-OLD SON is beside him wearing khakis a Polo shirt, just like his father.) GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is! The lord of the manor!
ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, everyone in the shack! The grand tour's about to begin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and his wife KIMMY (late-30's, high-maintenance) lead Rick, Fred, Maggie, Grace, and SEVERAL OTHER GUESTS into large wood-paneled study. (The Long's 7-YEAR-OLD DAUGHTER sticks to her mother's side WEARING A MATCHING DRESS.) ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call it headquarters. LARRY BOHAC, mid-40's, and his blonde bombshell of a wife MANDY, (who wears A TOO-TIGHT T-SHIRT) look around in awe MANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un-believable. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sweet of you to say, Mandy. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's epic, Ed. Ed points to one wall which houses a GLASSED-IN HUMIDOR. ED (RE: HUMIDOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this over here--this is the war room. The temperature in there never goes above fifty-four degrees, never below fifty-three. I even threw in a back-up generator in case we lose power and the main generator doesn't kick in. Now who wants a Cubano? They're the real deal--Coakley snagged them on his trip to Havana. KIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second, Ed, first I want to show them Lny headquarters. Fred looks at Rick and rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a Waterworks showroom. Despite its bloated opulence, Grace and Maggie can't help but be impressed. KIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my paradise. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a price tag north of one hundred and forty large, it better be paradise. Ed holds out his fist and Rick obediently POUNDS IT. Just then Grace NOTICES that Fred has disappeared.
GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where did Fred go? Rick turns and sees that he's missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick walks down a hall and finds Fred in a guest room watching a baseball game on TV. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take these look-at-how-much- I-own parties. It's obnoxious. Rick nods and sits down beside him. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I bought my completely-loaded Honda Odyssey, I didn't go around bragging about it, did I? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, kind of. You made me drive around town with you for two hours, remember? FRED (DEFENSIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd want to watch a movie in a mini-van. You never got to watch a movie in a mini-van before, did you? Rick shrugs. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you have to hook your boat up to it? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's the Touring Edition, numb-skull. The thing can tow more weight than ninety percent of the pick-ups out there! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody is admiring the antique fireplace. KIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mantle actually came all the way from Tuscany, which is in Europe. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, gang, check this out.
KIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Eddie, they don't need to see that--they'll think we're wackos. Ed PUNCHES A CODE into a keypad and the WALL SLIDES OPEN revealing a SAFE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, Grace, and the others follow Ed into a safe room filled with VIDEO MONITORS surveilling all the rooms in t house. When Kimmy ENTERS she pushes a button CLOSING THE WALL BEHIND THEM. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... this is like secret agent stuff. KIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think having a safe room is a bit over the top, but Ed feels with our two little ones you can never be too cautious. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, you're such a good daddy. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Grace) Rick can't even set up the baby monitors right. Ed points to a monitor where we see Rick and Fred ENTER t master bedroom. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here come Tweedle-dee and Tweedle- dum. CLOSE ON VIDEO MONITOR - we see Rick and Fred cross over the master bathroom doorway and look in.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: .All I'm saying is, who gets a mini-van when you don't even have any kids?

dialogues.speaker: FRED, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: You don't know much about the insurance game, do you, Rick? When you pull into a person's driveway to sell them life insurance, who do you think they'd rather see? A hot- shot in a Porsche or a family man in a mini-van? Hm? Rick looks around the empty room.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: Hey, where'd everyone go?
GRACE (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, we're in here! KIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't hear you. The room's completely soundproof. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And bulletproof. ON VIDEO MONITOR WALL - we see Rick and Fred LEAVE ONE SC and ENTER ANOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Fred walk back into Ed's study. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must've gone downstairs. Fred motions to Ed's humidor room. FRED (BRITISH ACCENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming to the war room, old chap. By the way, did I mention that my wife's vagina never goes above fifty-four degrees, nor below fifty-three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry Bohac CHUCKLES and Grace shifts uncomfortably. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, maybe we should turn this off. But Ed turns THE VOLUME UP. CLOSE ON MONITOR - Rick plays along with a BAD BRITISH ACCENT.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: Is that so, dear boy? And what happens if you lose power during a big blow and your main generator doesn't kick in?

dialogues.speaker: FRED, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: Well that's why I had the back-up generator installed in Kimmy's rumpus. Kimmy makes a face, shocked. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath; resigned) Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, speaking of installations, is that a shiny new set of cans on Mandy Bohac? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either that or she's wearing her daughter's t-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Mandy's surprised face. She looks at Larry, who' suddenly not so amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look good but I'll still take the real deal any day. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. You're telling me you'd take Kimmy Long's flapjacks over Mandy's new speedbags? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm telling you. I like boobs with a little mileage on 'em. They're more fun. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You can smoosh 'em, swing 'em, hump 'em, Stretch-Armstrong 'em. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about the proven correlation between floppy boobs and large-mouth vaginas?

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ED & KIMMY LONG'S ESTATE - MOMENTS LATER Maggie and Grace hurry down the front walk trailed by the shell-shocked husbands. A trembling and IRATE Kimmy is he back at the door by Ed and a couple other Guests. KIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people are horrible! Horrible! ED (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very disappointed, gentlemen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one speaks. Grace drives and Maggie sits beside her, humiliation etched across their faces. Finally: FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, anyone thinking chocolate chip cookie dough in a waffle cone? Grace YANKS the mini-van to the side of the road and GLAR BACK AT HIM. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large-mouth vaginas?! As the guys cower, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RICK & MAGGIE'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Rick looks small and weak sitting on the couch while Magg stands across from him rubbing her temples. It looks like the Norman Rockwell painting where the mom reprimands her little boy for sneaking a frog into the house. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what really troubles me? The thing that you're all so obsessed with is meaningless to you. It's really just about numbers with you guys. Rick looks up, confused. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, you can't even tel me the month you lost your virginity. I can tell you the exact day and hour that I lost mine. Rick seems a little embarrassed by this. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, virginity is different for guys. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is, obviously I like sex, too--it means something to me--but I don't walk around gawking at every guy I see. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, so I occasionally notice other women. I'm sorry. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Occasionally? Rick rakes his hands through his hair and decides to come clean.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you want the truth? You really want me to pull back the curtain here? From the moment I leave the house in the morning 'til the moment I get home, I pretty much notice every woman in my path. Maggie turns to face him. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not how you think it is, Mags. It's like... it's like a curse. I don't want to notice, but I can't help it. It's always been like that. I figured that when I c jot married that would be it, but it wasn't--the thing,doesn't give two shits about marriage. MAGGIE (HURT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you saying--you're not happy with our sex life? Rick reaches up and takes her hand. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Of course I'm happy, honey--our sex life is great--not that I wouldn't mind a little more, but-- look, one thing has nothing to do with the other. I think about sex a lot--all guys do--that's just the way it is. Maggie sits down beside him, clearly at the end of her ro No one speaks for a few moments. Then: MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm giving you a hall pass. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One week off from marriage. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, like a trial separation? You are seriously overreacting. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a separation, it's a hall pass. You can do whatever you want. Get it out of your system. RICK (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute--are you for real?
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a yes or no offer, and it's not a debate. You're getting a hall pass. As Maggie heads upstairs, we PUSH IN on a confused Rick. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie is washing out a pan at the sink when Rick ENTERS dressed for work. We hear the O.S. SOUNDS of The Wiggles coming from a TV in another room. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Morning. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not facing him) There's a couple hard-boiled eggs in a bowl there for you. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have to take them to go, hon, I've got a showing in fifteen minutes. Rick puts the eggs in his pocket, then approaches Maggie kisses her on the cheek. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, about this hall pass business.. .1 don't want it and I don't need it. All I need is-- MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, this isn't negotiable. She turns and faces him. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really serious about this? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, this isn't something that I...look, I really think you need this. I think we need this. Rick doesn't know what to say. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This afternoon I'm taking the kids out to my parent's beach house. Rick REACTS to this. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be back in one week. And as far as I'm concerned, starting right now. .. you have the week off from marriage. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a big shiny place. All fixed-up. Fred pulls up in his mini-van and gets out. He walks past a Coldwell Banke For Sale sign with Rick's name on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is showing the kitchen to a COUPLE, mid-40's, when F ENTERS. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing here? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called your office and they told me you were in the neighborhood. Rick turns to the couple. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is a friend of mine, Fred Searing. Fred, this is Harold and Nancy Goldberg--they're moving up here from Long Island. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, mazel tov, folks. The Goldbergs look at Fred a little warily as he takes ou card. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me give you my card. Home, auto, or life insurance--I'm the go-to mensch in town. HAROLD GOLDBERG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're good on insurance. Rick quickly jumps in. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Goldbergs) Uh, why don't you two take another look around and if you have any questions I'll be right here. HAROLD GOLDBERG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The Goldbergs walk out and Rick closes the door behind th
RICK (HUSHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the he 1 are you doing--I'm trying to make a sale here. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't picking up your cell--I wanted to see how much trouble you got in last night. You know what Grace made me do? She made me call the Longs and apologize. Rick flinches. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oof . FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout you--did Maggie freak out when you got home? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... sort of. Rick peeks out the kitchen door to make sure the Goldberg aren't listening. Then: RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gave me a hall pass. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week off from marriage to do whatever I want. She's going to her parents' house down the Cape 'til next Sunday. Fred SNICKERS. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're full of shit. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, it's true. You think I could make something like this up? Fred stares at him. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it--why aren't you more excited? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I don't know how I feel.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About...? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall pass. Something about it isn't right. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, like, you think Maggie might have a brain tumor or something? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean, just because my wife tells me it's okay to cheat... is it? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you just accept the fact that your wife is a goddamn saint, Rick? She's evolved. Don't you see? She gets it! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but there's a part of me that's saying, 'Wow, you must have pushed her pretty hard to get her to this point.' And is that good for a marriage? That your wife is willing to try something this insane? Fred can't believe his ears. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely! (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, doesn't it bother you that our wives dreams all come true, but ours don't? Look at Maggie; when she was a kid she played house--you g a ve her a house. She played with her E-Z-Bake Oven--you bought her a Viking. She played mommy--you made her a mommy. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The oven's a GE. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a real gas oven! And what about you, huh? Come on, man, your wife is living her dreams.. .and now it's time for you to live yours. As Rick thinks about this, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. FRED & GRACE'S HOUSE - NIGHT Fred and Grace climb the stairs at the end of the day.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I think this is some very forward-thinking on Maggie's part. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit lobbying--you're not getting a hall pass. And you mark my words, this is going to end up biting Maggie in the ass. At the top of the stairs Fred puts his arms around her. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I need a hall pass? I've got you. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight you don't. I'm too bloated and I have cramps. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, do I have to spell it out for you? I'm having my period. FRED (MATTER-OF-FACT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got that. He moves in for a kiss but she pulls away. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, hon, give me a break. Not tonight. Disappointed, Fred watches her walk toward the bedroom. FRED (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit--I forgot to take the trash out. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FRED & GRACE'S HOUSE - NIGHT Fred's mini-van is parked on the street in front of his h We HEAR Styx's The Best of Times coming from inside the c and we MOVE IN CLOSER until we're... LOOKING THROUGH THE PASSENGER WINDOW at Fred. He's sittin in the driver's seat; his EYES ARE CLOSED and his head is slung back as he JERKS-OFF (just below frame) to the MUSI A POLICE CRUISER passes in the b.g., then a moment later BACKS INTO FRAME and STOPS NEXT TO FRED. As the two POLICE OFFICERS look on from their car trying figure out what the guy is doing, the oblivious Fred continues to STROKE HIS MEAT to the BEAT.

Officer #1 gets out of the driver's side. He DISAPPEARS F FRAME and then REAPPEARS at Fred's driver's side window. only inches from Fred, he bends over and LOOKS INSIDE THE CAR. The Officer motions for his partner to join him. As Fred continues to POUND HIMSELF TO THE MUSIC, Officer #2 climb out of the cruiser. He takes out his flashlight and SHINE IT ON FRED'S O.S. LAP. As the weary officers look at each other with a NOW-WE'VE-SEEN-IT-ALL EXPRESSION, we... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The police lights are FLASHING now and several NEIGHBORS gathered on their front lawns to see what's going on. PAN to Fred's front steps where we see a HANDCUFFED Fred standing meekly as the two Police Officers confer with a furious-looking Grace (in her bathrobe.) OFFICER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, ma'am, if you say he's yours.. .you can have him. The Officer TAKES OFF FRED'S HANDCUFFS. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, officers. Fred scurries into the house ahead of Grace. As soon as t door shuts, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: IN HIS OWN FRONT YARD
dialogues.text: As the Police Officers head back to their car, we go... CLOSE ON a smiling Fred. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a Hall Pass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is at his desk staring at a giddy Fred. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter how. I got one. Can you believe it?! I got a hall pass! Rick stands up, elated. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I've got a hall pass! FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both have hall passes!
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does yours start? Fred looks at his watch. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-three minutes ago! She just left for the Cape--she's staying with Maggie. It's just you and me for the next six days! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, do you realize how much easier this is going to make it-- having a hall pass partner? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's not just me--Baker, Gary, and Hog-head are coming out with us tonight! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way?! They got hall passes, too?! FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no--they just want to watch. Rick grows concerned. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's a good idea, letting them in on it? What if they blab and it gets around town--it might embarrass our wives. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I already talked to them. Their lips are sealed. Rick and Fred smile. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're living the dream, baby!

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: Law & Order MUSIC CUE as we SUPER: DAY 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, Fred, and their MIDDLE-AGED POSSE (Baker, Hog-head Gary) walk across a boulevard like rock stars. (Think of SLO-MO shots from Swingers or Reservoir Dogs.) Nobody smiles, they're all business as they hit the sidewalk and march straight into ...APPLEBEE'S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step up to the bar.
RICK (TO BARTENDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five MGD's, my friend. While waiting for the beers, the guys CHECK OUT THE SCENE It's mostly FAMILIES, a few YOUNG COUPLES. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy at the Holiday Inn Express told me this place really kicks in around nine-thirty. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why are you staying at a hotel if your wives are out of town? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we can't very well take babes back to our places--if they know where we live they might end up stalking us. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I wouldn't be able to concentrate with all the pictures everywhere and the kids' cut-outs all over the fridge. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, isn't it weird how your own kids can creep you out sometimes? Rick shoots Gary a look. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the feeling there's a lot of divorcees in this place. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Divorcees are into kinky sex--that's why they're divorced. Just then the BARTENDER arrives with the Miller Genuine Drafts and the guys CLINK BOTTLES. HOG-HEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So come on, point out which girls you guys are gonna do tonight. Gary elbows Fred as he spots TWO MIDDLE-AGED WOMEN at the of the bar. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about those two? Why don't you bang them? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. They're doing the SWEATSHIRT-AROUND-THE-WAIST THING--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: they're obviously hiding something back there.     42 GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how about the blonde hostess? Maybe somebody should nail her, huh? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attempt to be cool, Gary--we've got a whole week. Baker looks around at the lame bar scene. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys sure that Applebee's is the best place to be picking up women? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking--Olive Garden? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, that's only good on Thursday nights. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what about the auto show? Baker shoots them a look. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys for real? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second--where's Coakley? That's where we should be. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Iceland. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing there? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think he's doing there? The guys all nod at this, proud of him. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, before we go bagging any chicks, I gotta get a hunk of beef in me. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I got a guy over at Outback Steak House who could set us up. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh, he's got pull over at Outback. Wow. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I like Outback. Let's chug these and hit the road.
As the guys drink up, Hog-head puts his arm around Gary. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Gar, you don't happen to have any connections at 7/11, do ya? Maybe someone could hook me up with a player's card so I can cut right to the front of the raspberry slurpy line. The guys all LAUGH, as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: CAPE COD BEACH COTTAGE
dialogues.text: This is an old summer shack nestled on a quiet bluff overlooking the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace stands at the window staring out on the ocean, whil Maggie nestles on the couch reading a summer novel. The k are asleep and the place is quiet. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we might've made a huge mistake. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop thinking about it, Grace. Why don t you just try to get some sleep? Grace turns to Maggie. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep? I can't sleep. I don't understand you--how can you Just sit there and read knowing that Rick could be making out with a supermodel right now? Maggie doesn't answer. GRACE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our husbands aren't married this week. Do you know what husbands do when they're not married? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. You're going to wake the kids. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to sit there and tell me you're not the least bit concerned about what they're doing right now? Maggie SIGHS. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I'm a little concerned.
Grace flops into the chair across from her. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm concerned. But what choice did we have? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could've kept the status quo. I mean, were things really that bad that we had to try something this extreme? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me they were. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you may call this a hall pass, but for me it's more of a Hail Mary pass. I'm serious, I don't know what else to do. Grace looks at Maggie, surprised. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember last week when we went to Lucy's award thing? Grace nods. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night when we got home, Rick and I were gonna.. .you know... and I was waiting for him in bed while he tucked the kids in, and I started wondering who he would be thinking about during sex. Would it be the girl he checked out on the way into the party? Or would it be Missy Frankenfield--because I noticed him gawking at her? Or how about one of the waitresses, or maybe somebody he saw at work that day? Then when he came into the room, I did something I'd never done before: I pretended to be asleep. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me? You've never done that? I do that all the time! Maggie almost smiles. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I understand that people have fantasies and that you're not always thinking about the person you're with. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for sure. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's just...I don't know... it's been too long since I felt that he was thinking about me.
They sit there for a moment, quiet. Then: MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need this hall pass to work, Grace, because if it doesn't, I don't know what's going to happen. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: OUTBACK STEAKHOUSE
dialogues.text: We see two VERY OLD COUPLES walking out with doggie bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our five guys are in a MEAT COMA, slouched in their chair nursing red wines and talking through PURPLE TEETH. Sever

dialogues.speaker: EMPTY WINE BOTTLES, MARTINI GLASSES, HALF-EATEN STEAKS,
dialogues.text: CARVED UP POTATO AU GRATIN and CREAMED SPINACH PLATES, an MANGLED KEY-LIME PIES litter the table. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... so where to now? Rick can't think in this state. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred...? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer Baker. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the question? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing for the rest of the night? FRED (DISINTERESTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Getting laid, right? HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go home and poo. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I put too much Hollandaise on the mozzarella sticks. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just back one out here? HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure I'm gonna need a bath afterwards.
Baker musters some initiative and STANDS UP. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you guys! I say we go to a strip club and smoke cigars-- that 11 wake us up! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a better idea. Rick STRETCHES. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go night-night. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we tie a bow on it and put her to bed. This is gonna be a long week so we should pace ourselves. Baker looks at his watch. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only nine-thirty! FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with Rico. (YAWNS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy tie-tie. GARY (DISAPPOINTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys serious? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, guys, this is just the calm before the storm. Get out the plywood and batten down the hatches. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Tonight we build up strength, tomorrow we make landfall.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: Law & Order MUSIC CUE as we SUPER: DAY 2

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Rick, Fred, Hog-head, and Gary are stretching on the firs tee of a local FOUR-STAR GOLF RESORT while taking in the sights. Nearby, we see the hotel swimming pool lined with ATTRACTIVE WOMEN in bikinis.
HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. This place sure beats the hell out of the Holiday Inn Express. Why aren't you staying here? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too pricey. Besides, since we're paying for golf we get full access to the resort--including the pool bar. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mothers, lock up your daughters-- the dogs are off the leash! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn-and-burn, baby! Gary raises his hand for a HIGH-FIVE, but Rick balks. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. I don't do that. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I say screw the golf--let's go straight to the pool bar and start getting you guys laid! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoch-head, relax, the pool bar ain't going nowhere. Besides, it'll be good for us to get a little sun before making our grand entrance-- chicks love a healthy glow. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus it wouldn't hurt to work up a little sweat--get those pheromones flying. Just then, two sexy BEER-CART GIRLS wave as they pass. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked me into it. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys, look what I brought. Gary holds up a ZIPLOCK BAG full of something chocolatey. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pot brownskies. The guys all look at one another, baffled. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, are we on spring break? Where the hell'd you get those? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an in.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With who? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy who washes my dog. Go ahead. He holds out the bag and the guys hesitate. GARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eating it isn't like smoking it. It's a much mellower buzz--you'll just feel relaxed. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they chocolatey? As Hog-Head SNIFFS the brownies, Rick takes a practice sw RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hog-head, come on, who eats pot brownies at eleven in the morning when they're playing golf? HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Daly? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, Rick, this is spring break! You've got a hall pass! Live it up, man! It'll probably help your rap with the ladies later. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary's right--when are we ever gonna get the chance to do pot brownies again? Hog-Head takes a brownie and BITES INTO IT. HOG-HEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. These are yummy. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even have a hall pass. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? I can still live vicariously through you guys, can't I? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not vicarious if you're actually doing it. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. Just hit your ball. Hog-Head takes ANOTHER BITE. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what the hell, it's not like my game can get any worse.
Rick watches Fred pick up a brownie and TENTATIVELY TASTE Then Gary INHALES HIS IN ONE BITE. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, give me one of those things. As Rick drops his club and walks toward the brownies, we SUPER: 75 MINUTES LATER

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: A dazed and confused Rick and Fred are RECLINING in their cart in the middle of the fairway. For a while neither of them speak. Then: FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of soap do you use? RICK (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean in the shower? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dove. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I like Dove--it doesn't dry your skin so much. Fred stares into space. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes it's hard to wash off, though. Because of the moisturizer. You ever notice--? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Hog-head's dead. Fred looks over and sees Hog-head SPRAWLED OUT ON HIS BAC A SAND TRAP. He's not moving. FRED (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hog-head...? Are you okay? As Hog-head starts to make SNOW ANGELS IN THE SAND, an elderly COURSE RANGER pulls up in a golf cart. RANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doing? Rick and Fred grow visibly tense at the sight of an autho figure. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, he's having back spasms.
RANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not him. Him. Rick and Fred turn and see Gary STANDING CHEST-DEEP in th MIDDLE OF A POND just STARING AT THEM. RICK (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary! What are you doing?! GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know--you tell me! Gary starts to LAUGH MANIACALLY. The Ranger turns to Rick annoyed. RANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this is the third time I've had to flag your group and you're only on the fourth hole. Now if I have to come out here again, you're done for the day. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha. We'll pick it up, sir. The Ranger shoots them a look and DRIVES OFF toward the T ASIAN FOURSOMES waiting on the tee behind them. CUT TO: SUPER: 27 MINUTES LATER

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: The four guys are unnaturally bunched together on another fairway. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think. Where did you last see it? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the course. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where on the course? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know--on a fairway, I think. I clot out, grabbed my club, took a swing, and when I turned around it had disappeared. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious? You're telling us you lost your golf cart? FRED (STONER VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, where's my golf cart?
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Fred. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, I gotta go poo again. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't lose it, I think it was stolen. RICK (ANNOYED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would steal a golf cart? Gary shrugs. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criminals? HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone have any napkins? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, all I know is I had it on the seventh tee and now it's gone. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We're only on the sixth hole. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Did we miss a hole? Where's my kids? Rick closes his eyes and rubs his head, trying to keep it together. Then he NOTICES something O.S.. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, man! ANOTHER ANGLE REVEALS Hog-head down in a greenside bunker PULLING UP HIS PANTS. As he starts to KICK SAND over his O.S. POOP like a cat in its litter box, we HEAR a noise a the guys look up. THEIR POV - the Golf Ranger comes flying over a hill head straight for them. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run for it! The guys run toward Rick's cart, jump in, and take off. R and Fred are in the seats, while Gary and Hog-head HANG O THE BACK. The cart BARRELS down a cart path with the Rang HOT IN PURSUIT. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gaining on us! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go any faster, I've got it floored!
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut through the woods! Without slowing down, Rick TURNS SHARPLY TO THE RIGHT and Gary and Hog-head TUMBLE OUT OF THE CART. With panic etched across their sweaty faces, Gary and Hog head quickly jump to their feet and run after the cart. R slows just enough for them to catch up and jump back on, he speeds down a maintenance path and DISAPPEARS INTO THE WOODS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Kimmy Long are sitting at an outside table having lunch with their two young children. Their 7-Year-Old Daughter is again dressed just like her mother and the 5- Old Son is dressed like the father. 7-YEAR-OLD DAUGHTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mom, look! The family turns to see... THEIR POV - a stoned-looking Rick, Fred, Hog-head and Gar are driving the golf cart down the city street.
