They stop a traffic light beside them. All the guys stare straight ahead, ZOMBIE-LIKE, except for Fred who NOTICES the Longs He nods. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed. Kimmy. Clones. The light changes and as the golf cart DRIVES OFF through busy intersection, we go BACK ON ED AND KIMMY shaking their heads. KIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their poor wives.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: Law & Order MUSIC CUE as we SUPER: DAY 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a picture perfect day as a THOUSAND PEOPLE watch a C Cod League baseball game rom the comfort of their picnic blankets. The home team has loaded the bases in the botto of the ninth and Grace, Maggie, MAGGIE'S PARENTS, and the kids are CLAPPING ALONG WITH THE CROWD. CRACK! The BATTER HITS A ROPE TO RIGHT FIELD, and as the TYING and WINNING RUNS SCORE the PLACE GOES WILD.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The PLAYERS and FANS mingle on the field immediately afte the game.

Grace and Maggie stand near the pitcher's mound as they w Maggie's kids run the bases. The wives look TANNED and REFRESHED from several days laying on the beach. Just then a big, goofy kid named GERRY approaches. He's a strapping 22-year-old first baseman from Puerto Rico with perpetual SHIT-EATING GRIN. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm Gerry--thanks for coming out and supporting us. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it was fun. You guys looked good. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Gerry glances back at his TEAMMATES who are clearly eggin him on. GERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...we saw you sitting up there with those little kids--are you nannies or something? The girls aren't immune to flattery and they smile. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're my kids. GERRY (DUBIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. You have three kids? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. A couple other PLAYERS amble over. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudes, they're not nannies, they're mommies. PLAYER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way?! GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she is, not me. I'm not old enough yet. Maggie and the players LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Guys! The players turn to see their coach, RICK COLEMAN, approaching with MAGGIE'S FATHER, mid-70's.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time to pack things up--let's go!
The Players quickly scatter. MAGGIE'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, Grace, this is Rick Coleman- -the coach. Rick Coleman is a granite-jawed 38-year-old with a good h of hair and an easy-going manner. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope those clowns weren't bothering you. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, they were sweet. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Cute kids. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the guy who's been taking money off my dad every Saturday on the golf course? RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to break it to you but your old man's the one who's been taking all the money--he's a thief. Maggie's Father LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, everyone's coming back to my place for some beers and a barbecue- -why don't you join us? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks, but we've gotta get the kids home. MAGGIE'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom and I will take 'em home. You two go out and have a good time- -cripes, you haven't been out all week. Grace perks up at this. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know, Dad, we really HADN'T PLANNED-- GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can I have a word with you? Grace pulls Maggie aside. GRACE (CONT'D) (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem?
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Grace, these guys are barely out of college, and, in case you've forgotten, we're married. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To who? Last I heard, Rick and Fred had the week off from marriage. So remind me again--who are we married to? Maggie thinks about this. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I guess one beer won't kill us. GRACE (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my girl. Grace glances over at the ballplayers. GRACE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't we have fun? God knows our guys are living it up. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you guys rather do--make- out with a guy or let him blow you? PULL BACK TO REVEAL that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Our five guys are sitting at the bar drinking beer and devouring plates of HOT WINGS. Around them we see about fifty TV's BLARING twenty different sporting events. Ther ESPN logos everywhere and not a woman in sight. HOG-HEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've gotta pick one or someone in your family will die-- that's the rule. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy, that's a toughie. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long would you have to make-out with him? HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tongue?
HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how long would he have to blow you? HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven minutes. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oof. I mean, getting blown by a dude is bad, but making out with a guy, it's so.. .intimate. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's more intimate than getting blown by a guy? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way more. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, the hell with this shit, I'm outta here. Baker gets up from his stool. RICK (TAKEN ABACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to watch you guys pick up chicks, not talk about dicks. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, greased lightning, let off the gas--sometimes these things take time. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baker's right. This is day three and you haven't even talked to a girl. RICK (POINTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not exactly accurate, Gary. Thanks to your scrumptious brownies, I did spend half of last night talking to Judy on the drug- and-poison hotline. Hog-head and Gary stand. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm gonna get going, too. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is boring. You guys are pussies.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I haven't seen you guys talk to any girls. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have hall passes! (SHAKES HEAD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, guys, let's go. The three friends start to leave but Hog-head stops and turns. HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys, it's all right if you strike-out.. .but for godsakes, at least take a couple of swings. A moment later the guys are gone and a humbled Rick and F sit there feeling alone. FRED (BEING BRAVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is actually good--you know, that they're leaving. You don't need five hunters to bag two birds. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you do not. And I love those guys but, let's be honest, they're not exactly chick-magnets. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can say that again. Yep, the steak always looks better if you trim away some of the fat. And let's face it, we are the steak. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dream team, baby. The guys CLINK BEERS. Then: RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should call the girls and ask them to come home. Fred glances at him, aghast. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are we kidding, man? Do you really think we're going to be picking up any girls this week? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't we? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's not us anymore. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. You want to quit?
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, we're not the same guys we were fifteen years ago, back when we were single. We've changed. Fred stares at him, incredulous. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, you've changed. All you care about is yourself--what about all the guys out there who are counting on us to make this thing work? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? (DRAMATIC BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the chosen ones! Fred stands up and points at Rick. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right--this thing is bigger than us! Our wives didn't give us this hall pass, the good Lord did! And what do we have to show for it? Nothing. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come off it, Fred. Obviously hooking up isn't something we really want--if it was, we could've done it by now. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we have? Rick is taken aback by this. RICK (WANING CONFIDENCE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ...of course. I mean, if we'd really wanted to. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what? I did want to. And you know how close I got? We're three days in and the only woman I've spoken to was our waitress at Outback. And she never even made eye-contact. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really care if some waitress makes eye-contact. I want to go home--I miss my wife and kids.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me explain something to you: If Grace and Maggie find out we can't get laid on our own, they'll start thinking we need them to get laid. Do you know what that'll do to the balance of power in our homes? It'll destroy it! Rick thinks about this and grows alarmed. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what if we just tell them that we did hook up? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't. Grace'll know. She always knows when I'm lying. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what about a massage parlor? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That's giving up. Fred glares at him. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it, do you? A hall pass ain't all about sex. It's about being man enough to pick up a woman even though you may not be what--in the traditional sense--is considered... (makes quotes with FINGERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .good-looking, or... (finger quotes again) .appealing. Rick seems stung by this news. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if we can't show that something positive can come from having a hall pass, then the whole concept is dead. Not just for us...but for all mankind. Rick thinks about this for a moment, then stands up with RENEWED SENSE OF PURPOSE. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's get out of here. I know exactly where we should be. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party's in full swing. A hundred or so PLAYERS, PLAYE GIRLFRIENDS, and FRIENDS are in and out of the pool, drin beer and rocking out to Arcade Fire on the boombox.
ANGLE ON Maggie and Rick Coleman sipping beers while in t b.g. we see Grace PLAYING VOLLEYBALL in the pool (still i the shorts and t-shirt she wore that afternoon.) MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how about you, Rick, do you have any children? RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, but maybe some day. Your mom keeps talking about hooking me up with your cousin Kate. Maggie LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's not a good sign. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I hardly know her. She moved to Miami when I was eight. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what your mom said. I coach at the University of Miami. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you should go out with her. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how about yourself--how long you been married? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...fourteen years. We were college sweethearts. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. And where is he this week? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's up in Boston. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor guy. All work and no play, huh? Maggie forces a smile. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. Suddenly Grace is PROPELLED OUT OF THE WATER and UP ONTO GERRY'S SHOULDERS. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! What are you doing?!
Gerry LAUGHS and BOUNCES AROUND THE POOL and Grace and Ma and the coach can't help but LAUGH along with him, as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Fred pull into the hotel's lot in the mini-van. Rick gets out, Fred reaches behind his seat and comes out clutching a MOTORCYCLE HELMET. Rick stares at him. FRED (DEFENSIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicks dig motorcycles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 80's night and a Hall & Oates cover band is PLAY complete with look-alikes, except Oates is black. Behind band there's a banner that reads: 'Ramada Inn proudly welcomes the Mutual of Omaha Leadership Council!' We see middle-aged CORPORATE TYPES everywhere. DARRYL HALL (SINGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ". .Oh-oh here she comes, watch out boy she'll chew you up. Oh-oh here she comes, she's a maneater..." ANGLE ON THE BAR where Rick and Fred are checking out the scene. Fred is WEARING THE HELMET. (It's a huge BLACK, OVERSIZED HELMET WITH A VISOR.) He pulls it off, SHAKES O HIS HAIR, and places it prominently ON THE BAR. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackpot, baby. Rick NOTICES SOMETHING O.S.. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about those two? ANGLE ON two pretty LATINO WOMEN sitting alone at a table FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, yeah. Daddy likes. Fred pulls a piece of paper out of his back pocket and ha it to Rick. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went on-line this afternoon and wrote down some good pick-up lines to break the ice. RICK (READING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Hi. Will you help me find my puppy? I think he ran into the cheap hotel across the street.'
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good one--except for one thing: We don't have a puppy, so when she gets there she'll realize we're full of shit. Rick shoots him a look. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's supposed to be for real. It's just to make her laugh so she'll talk to you. Fred considers this. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God no, it doesn't work on that level. Here, this is my favorite. He takes the paper from Rick. FRED (CONT'D) (READING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'You must be from Ireland because when I look at you my penis is Dublin.' RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a charmer but you know what? We don't need phony pick-up lines. Why don't we just be ourselves? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. If you know how to. Rick takes a DEEP BREATH and braces himself. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the helmet. Fred hands him the helmet, then Rick marches up to the tw Latino Women with the helmet under his arm and Fred close his heels. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. The women give him a pleasant look. LATINO WOMAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Fred gives a little wave from behind Rick. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hola. LONG BEAT as Rick tries to figure what to say next. Then: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.. .this is awkward. I feel like I'm back at my first junior high school mixer.
Rick and Fred force a LAUGH and the girls smile. Another LONG, UNCOMFORTABLE BEAT. Rick clears his throat. RICK CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...are you ladies from Ireland? LATINO WOMAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. RICK. I'm very surprised to hear that news, because when I look at you my penis doubles in size. The women FLINCH at this, losing their smiles. Fred leans FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he means his dick is Dublin. Like the city. In Ireland. As the girls turn away from them, we begin a... MUSIC MONTAGE - Hall & Oates' I Can't Go For That pla our GUYS GET SHOT DOWN by a DOZEN DIFFERENT BEAUTIFUL WOM END MONTAGE

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Rick and Fred are at the bar looking TIRED and FRUSTRATED RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this overwhelming urge to donkey-kick everyone in this bar. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, tiger, keep your chin up--no one said this was going to be easy. Even in college you had to take fifty rejections for every score, remember? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it didn't sting so much when I was drunk. Fred perks up. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! We should be drinking! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. We're too stiff. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way too stiff. We gotta start pounding 'em, get those creative juices flowing, bring the soul to the surface. Rick smiles.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when we're at our most charming!

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: A HAMMERED Fred is HOLDING A HAND OVER ONE EYE as he SHOU at a table full of GORGEOUS YOUNG WOMEN. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say no to me? You say no to me?! I SAY NO TO YOU! He's being restrained by an unusually patient BOUNCER. In the b.g. we see Rick PASSED OUT ON A STOOL in a VERY AWKW POSITION. BOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, buddy, let's go... The women glare at Fred with disgust, maybe even a little amusement. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, screw them! (pointing at the women) You think your shit don't stink?! Well I got news for ya: I wouldn't titty-bang you in a snow storm! 20-SOMETHING WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking), Oh, please, sir, please titty-bang us in a snow storm! The women LAUGH. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, you blew it, not gonna happen. BOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still restraining Fred) There you go, mister, you got 'em good. Now let's go. As the Bouncer drags him toward the exit, a STUNNING GIRL passes them WEARING TIGHT LEATHER PANTS with an AMERICAN PRINT ON THE BUTT. Fred turns to her. FRED (SLURRING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetie, you need a pole for that flag? Just then, the Girl's LARGE BOYFRIEND appears, and as his FIST MEETS FRED'S FACE, we

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: Law & Order MUSIC CUE as we SUPER:
DAY 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SNORING Rick is FAST ASLEEP, sprawled out on his back o the bed WEARING ONLY HIS BOXERS despite the clock next to reading 3:37 in the afternoon. He's surrounded by several left-over ROOM SERVICE TRAYS. ANOTHER ANGLE reveals Fred CURLED UP NAKED ON THE BATHROO FLOOR, also SNORING. HE USES A BATH MAT AS A PILLOW.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: Law & Order MUSIC CUE as we SUPER: DAY 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worn-out-looking Rick is working at his desk when Fred approaches (with a BLACK EYE.) FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what we've been doing wrong. Rick lifts his chin. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're gonna break out of this slump, we've got to start using our strength. And that is.. .people who know us, like us. So we should go after the women we've already won over. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like our wives? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like that, but not them. Fred sits in the chair across from Rick. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking Coffee Girl. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've won over Coffee Girl? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure she'd recognize me. Rick thinks about this. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if you really want to go after someone you already know, have you considered Missy Frankenfield?
Fred's listening. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got all the stats you like-- she's beautiful, you k now her phone n ow- number, she's freshly divorced... FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which according to Hog-head means she's horny. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo. As Fred smiles, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie and Grace are laying outintheir bathing suits when they hear O.S. YELLING and lookupto see the baseball play Gerry WATERSKIING toward them.Helets go of the rope and skis UP ONTO THE SHORE. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, beach bunnies? Grace and Maggie sit up and smile. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? He KICKS OFF THE SKI, then runs over and SHAKES HIS WET B ALL OVER THE GIRLS. GRACE & MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry, stop it! GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where are the kiddies? We thought we'd take you all for a boat ride. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents took them to Martha's Vineyard for the weekend. Just then, we hear a LOUD HORN. They look up to see the b pulling close to shore. Rick Coleman is behind the wheel a couple PLAYERS are in the back. Maggie waves. RICK COLEMAN (THROUGH BULLHORN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, everybody aboard! We're going waterskiing! The two women look at each other--why not? As they get up and RUN INTO THE WATER, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stands in line at the coffee shop looking casual in slacks and a Harvard t-shirt. Music plays. He peers ahead and sees the Wannabe Artist-Type taking the order of a TEENAGE GIRL. At the other register, Coffee Girl is also taking orders. Rick is hoping to get Coffee Girl but Wann gets to him first. WANNABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take your order? Rick sees that there's no one behind him. He turns to the Wannabe. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...I don't know what I want. Wannabe stares at him, waiting. Rick hesitates a few moments, then levels with the guy. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man, I want her to take my order. WANNABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, she knows how I like it. WANNABE (ATTITUDE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little help, Leigh--your unique barista skills have been requested. Rick waves weakly to Leigh and winks. As Leigh approaches Wannabe mocks Rick by waving at him and winking. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. What would you like? Rick was hoping to have a conversation but Wannabe is crowding them. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iced coffee. With two Splendas. Leigh rings him up. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be two dollars. Rick hands her a fiver and nods toward the speakers. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, nice tunes. Do you choose 'em or do they come down from corporate? LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me. It's Snow Patrol.
She hands Rick his change and he dumps it in the tip jar. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice soundtrack. Pretty solid movie, too. Wannabe BARKS out a LAUGH. WANNABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you're thinking of Snow Do s-- the Cuba Gooding kiddie flick. This is Snow Patrol, the band. Rick shrugs, a little embarrassed. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tip. As Leigh grabs a cup and goes to make the coffee, Wannabe SAYS SOMETHING to her that WE CAN'T HEAR and they both LA A PHONE RINGS in the employee room. Leigh hands Wannabe t coffee, then runs back to answer it. Wannabe hands Rick t iced coffee and winks at him. WANNABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your two-Splenda'd iced coffee, mister. Rick starts to go, then turns around and stares at Wannab Wannabe, comforted by the counter between them, smiles ba RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you smiling? You think this counter is some alligator-infested moat? Rick's stare becomes a glare and Wannabe loses his smile. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little 'I'm-on-the-inside, too- cool-for-school, let's-laugh-at-the- DORKY-SUBURBAN-GUY-CAUSE-I'M-SAFE- ON-THIS-SIDE-OF-THE-COUNTER'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: routine's gonna get you hurt. After you lose all of your family's money on your avante garde piece of crap short film, you're going to need a job. And it's guys like me that hire. And guys like me don't hire punks like you. So shape up. As Rick turns and walks out, we PAN over to see that Leig HAS BEEN WATCHING THIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits alone at a table on the sidewalk drinking his coffee. He NOTICES some postcards advertising a two-week free trial at the local gym and starts to read them.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I work-out there.
Rick looks up, suddenly finding himself alone with Leigh. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? Leigh nods and starts to straighten up the tables. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work-out at home, but I was thinking of going public with my work-outs. What do you squat? She seems amused by this. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really squat, just run on the hamster-wheel everyday after work. She starts wiping down a table. COFFEE GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did you go to Harvard? She nods at Rick's t-shirt. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you know...I went to a party there once. Coffee Girl GIGGLES and Rick perks up. RICK (CONT'D) (RE:SHIRT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, this is Harvard Health Care. Sleep apnea... snoring too much. (holds up gym postcard) So is this a good place to join? LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great place. Real chill. And they have a bar, so I always grab a beer after my workout. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitchin'. Sounds like a nice routine. Maybe I'll routine it, too. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you join, tell 'em Leigh sent you--they'll give me two free months. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do that, Leigh. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rockin'. Leigh gives him the peace sign.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R-O-C-K in the U-S-A. Leigh smiles and as she heads back inside, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RICK & FRED'S HOTEL ROOM - DAY Fred is sitting on his bed flipping through his address b until he comes to Missy Frankenfield. He hits the SPEAKERPHONE and DIALS. Several RINGS later:

dialogues.speaker: MISSY FRANKENFIELD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Missy. Sorry I missed your call. I'm out of town for a few days, and I may have limited cell reception. Please leave a message and I'll get back to you as soon as I can. BEEP. Fred mouths the word 'shit', then picks up the receiver. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Missy, this is Fred Searing. I . uh, I dust wanted to give you a ring and, um...well, give me a call when you get back. It's kind of an emergency. Well, not life- threatening, but-- The machine CUTS HIM OFF. Fred HANGS UP, dejected. He sit there for a BEAT, then grabs his keys and GOES OUT THE DO CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON FRED - he's wearing SHADES and has a BASEBALL CA pulled down over his eyes. PULL BACK TO REVEAL that he's outside a MASSAGE PARLOR. A he approaches the massage parlor entrance, a bunch of LAD walk out of the TRAVEL AGENCY just to the right so Fred v into the DRY CLEANERS to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred ENTERS and immediately bumps into Kimmy Long (Ed's w standing in line behind several other WOMEN. She is accompanied by her 7-year-old daughter and neither of the look happy to see him. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi. Kimmy nods blankly. The Daughter glares at him. Fred nervously steps up next to them in line, passing time as waits for the sidewalk to clear. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I don't think I got a chance to tell you how impressed I was with your new place. Absolutely elegant.
Kimmy GRUNTS a thank you and turns away from him. ANGLE ON the KOREAN LADY who owns the dry cleaners. She stands behind the desk with an accordion wall behind her.

dialogues.speaker: DRY CLEAN KOREAN LADY
dialogues.text: Mr. Searing, you pick up last week-- no more clothes here! Fred smiles uncomfortably at Kimmy. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right... (looks at watch) Well, gotta get going--I have a meeting across town in ten minutes. See ya. Fred EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred comes out of the dry cleaners, makes sure the coast clear, then DUCKS INTO THE MASSAGE PARLOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN is behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: You want massage? Fred looks around. There's an OLD KOREAN LADY sitting on couch. He looks at the Young Korean Woman and nods.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You fill out. The Young Korean Woman hands Fred a form. Fred puts it do and covertly moves in. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer no paper trail.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: Need for insurance company. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think my insurance company's gonna cover this one.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: Ten dollar co-pay? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: Fill out form. It policy. Fred moves in closer.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't really want this in print. The Young Korean Woman hands him back the form.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: How I know what you want if you no fill out form? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, couldn't I just tell you? She stares at him for a LONG BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: So, what you waiting for?! Fred glances back at the Old Korean Lady, then WHISPERS i the Young Korean Woman's ear. She nods and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay.. .but must see I.D. first. Fred SIGHS and pulls out a hundred-dollar bill. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a C-note so I don't have to fill out any forms or show any I.D.'s? The Young Korean Woman thinks about this for a moment, th SLIDES OPEN THE ACCORDION WALL behind her, REVEALING... THE DRY CLEANERS NEXT DOOR - the Dry Cleaning Korean Lady looks back at him, along with Kimmy Long, her daughter, a ALL THE OTHER WOMEN IN LINE.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KOREAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: Gentleman want a rub-and-tug with tea-bag happy ending but don't fill out form! Kimmy Long glares at him, appalled. As Fred backpedals OU OF THE MASSAGE PARLOR, he waves at her weakly, and we... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred GUESTS dance on the top deck of this large sh as the Bee Gee's Night Fever BLASTS from the speakers. SONG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Night fever, night fever.. .we know how to do it...' As the song heats up, the crowd parts, REVEALING... Rick Coleman and Gerry decked-out in WHITE, TONY-MANARO-SUITS. They're DANCING UP A STORM with Maggie and Grace who are thrilled to be in such capable hands. Grace is getting tossed around a bit, but it's clear that Maggie can hold own on a dance floor.
The crowd soon FORMS A CIRCLE around the two couples, and Rick and Gerry SWING AND LIFT our delighted and breathles wives, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Maggie and Rick Coleman are standing at the rail of the b taking a breather. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You can really move out there. Maggie shrugs modestly. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I was a dance major in college. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I always wondered--what do you do with a degree in dance? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as it turned out, nothing. (BLUSHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess the original plan was to go to New York and try to hook-up with one of the big dance companies, but then I got married and. . .your priorities change. She looks away, maybe a little embarrassed. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, that was fun. I haven't danced this much in a long time. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, you get busy, kids, school, there's so much going on. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you gotta make time for the stuff you love or you'll forget who you are. Maggie appreciates the sentiment. She makes strong eye- contact with Rick for a moment, but catches herself and l away. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, my husband's name is Rick. Rick smiles at this.
RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that makes me the perfect guy to have an affair with--you'd never have to worry about screaming out the wrong name during sex. Maggie smiles at this, but she seems a nick uncomfortable

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm kidding. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now come on, let's go find Grace and get something to eat. I'm starving. As they head back to the party, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is parked across the street from FITNESS FIRM HEALTH CLUB. He's reading the newspaper and glancing at the entrance for Leigh. Suddenly there's a LOUD TAP on the window and Rick looks over to see Flats (who we met at Ri poker night) standing outside with a shit-eating grin. Ri rolls down the window. FLATS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rick. RICK (STARTLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...hey, Flats. How you doing, man? FLATS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. What's up with you? How's that hall pass thing going? Rick makes a Scooby Doo sound, alarmed. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you about that--was it Hog- head? FLATS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Some old lady was yakking about it down at the post office. Rick REACTS to this. FLATS (CONT'D) (BIG SMILE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the deal--you getting laid? RICK (DEFENSIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No.
RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where you're getting your information, Flats, but a hall pass isn't just about getting laid, it's about getting a week off from marriage to do as you please-- whether that be fishing, or watching TV, whatever it is that relaxes you. FLATS (DUBIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't know that. Just then Rick NOTICES Leigh (dressed in work-out clothes walking down the sidewalk toward the gym. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Flatsy, I gotta run. I'm late for my work-out appointment. When Rick hops out of his car, we see that he's wearing g shorts and an old Springsteen t-shirt. He hesitates, then grabs a SWEATSHIRT out of the car and TIES IT AROUND HIS WAIST. Rick hurries down the sidewalk toward Leigh. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, girl! LEIGH (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! You decided to go for it. As Rick follows Leigh into the gym, a smiling Flats CALLS OUT: FLATS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rick! Good luck with the fishing! As Flats begins to LAUGH, a sheepish Rick scurries into t building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Leigh stand at the front desk. A young, buff dud CLYDE, looks up from folding towels. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde, this is my friend, uh... RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's looking to join. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'll get you signed up. Leigh pats Rick's hand. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.
She turns to leave. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh, are you gonna grab a brewski after your work-out? LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. Rick looks disappointed. LEIGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna grab two. Leigh flashes him a smile and as she walks away, she give him the peace sign. He returns it. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace it! As soon as he hears himself, Rick cringes. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON RICK'S FACE - he's wearing the headphones and ha worked up a PRETTY GOOD SWEAT. PULL BACK to reveal that he's SITTING ON THE TOILET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a FLUSH. Rick shuffles out of a stall and moves t sink. While he washes his hands, a young, NAKED, METROSEX TYPE whips his leg into the sink beside him. Rick slowly turns to look. RICK'S POV - as the Metrosexual talks to ANOTHER NAKED MA he fills his hand with SHAVING CREAM and the hand DISAPPE BETWEEN HIS OWN LEGS. The guys continue their conversatio unfazed. Then the Metrosexual starts to SHAVE HIS BALLS. As Rick dries his hands, he can't contain himself. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that about--you swimming the English Channel? The Metrosexual shoots Rick an annoyed look. METROSEXUAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, Just not into looking like the knuckle-dragging guy on the evolution-of-man chart. Off Rick looking self-consciously down at his fur-covered body, we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick ENTERS the empty hot tub room, takes off his towel, eases into the STEAMING WATER. He hits a button and the j kick on FULL BLAST, turning the hot tub into a BUBBLY CAULDRON.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...yes. He bunches up his towel and puts it behind his head, then settles in and CLOSES HIS EYES. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Rick is in a DEEP SLEEP. His mouth is wide open but his h is BARELY ABOVE WATER as he SNORES LOUDLY. He dips beneat the surface and as he begins to CHOKE and COUGH, he wakes Rick takes a moment to get his bearings, then STRUGGLES t get out of the hot tub. But his MUSCLES HAVE TURNED TO JE RICK (WEAKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little help... When none comes, a life-and-death STRUGGLE ensues as the flabby, middle-aged dad tries to climb to safety. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help ...me... Just as Rick starts to go under, the two young naked metrosexuals hear his MOANS and come to his rescue. They jump in the hot tub and heave him ashore. As Rick GASPS f air, one of the metrosexuals kneels down and lifts Rick's head onto his NAKED LAP. NAKED METROSEXUAL #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having chest pains, sir? RICK (WINDED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I think I was...in the hot tub too long. I can't feel my body. NAKED METROSEXUAL #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you in there? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it? NAKED METROSEXUAL #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven-thirty. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About three hours. That's when Rick realizes that his head is RESTING ON THE GUY'S COCK. He tries to roll off him, but Metrosexual #1 HOLDS HIM TIGHT. NAKED METROSEXUAL #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to move, sir. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay, just help me up.
NAKED METROSEXUAL #1 (TO METROSEXUAL #2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, give him a hand. Metrosexual #2 straddles Rick's chest and leans down to p him up. As Rick starts to rise, HIS FACE COMES PERILOUSLY CLOSE TO THE SECOND MAN'S O.S. DANGLING COCK and Rick has TURN HIS HEAD TO AVOID CONTACT. They finally get Rick to his feet. As the naked men help across the room, we ANGLE ON - two TANNED, HAIRLESS METROSEXUAL ASSES flankin Rick's HIRSUTE BUTT. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks, guys. I can take it from here. The metrosexuals release Rick and he gets about two steps before his LEGS GIVE OUT and he TUMBLES DOWN A SMALL FLIG OF STEPS.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: Law & Order MUSIC CUE as we SUPER: DAY 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A depressed Rick and Fred sit in bed numbing their pain b WATCHING THE BOURNE SUPREMACY and eating a couple PINTS O BEN AND JERRY'S ICE CREAM. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We let down the male species. (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really thought our hall passes might change the philosophy of marriage in America. Fred eats a big scoop of ice cream. FRED (CONT'D) (WITH MOUTH-FULL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I envisioned a national holiday, right between July 4th and Labor Day, like the first Friday in August, Hall Pass Day; a day for husbands to get some strange, a day that would forever be known as the holiday,that saved the institution of marriage. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, don't give up. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not giving up, I'm facing facts- -this is our last day and we got nothing cooking. Maybe you were right. Maybe we should just tell the girls to come home.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want the hall pass. Fred looks at Rick, surprised. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I wasn't sure, but now I want the dream. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even sure I know what the dream is anymore. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just...I just want to know what it's like to be with another woman. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just pull up one of the golden oldies in your spank bank-- it's almost like being there. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have anything in that spank bank. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about all the girls before you met Maggie. Rick doesn't say anything. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not serious? Rick lowers his head. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second, are you saying...? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how can that be--you didn't meet Maggie until college? RICK (DEFENSIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so? What do you think, everyone gets laid in high school? I got news for you, mister--getting laid in high school is not a right, it's a privilege. Fred puts down his ice cream. Rick SIGHS. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First class, first day, freshman year, I saw Maggie--she was sitting three seats away in Western Civ-- and I fell in love instantly. I begged her for three months to go out with me, she finally caved, and that night I told her I loved her.
RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty-four days later she told me she loved me back and we've been together ever since. Fred stares at him. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That's a really creepy story. Just then Fred's cell phone RINGS and he ANSWERS it. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay, great. Fred hangs up but doesn't say anything. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just an angel from heaven. Suddenly Fred jumps to his feet. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coakley's back in town! As Rick's face fills with renewed hope, we... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie and Grace are sitting at the kitchen table gazing BOUQUET OF FLOWERS and an open GIFT BOX displaying an ENGRAVED I.D. BRACELET. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean you're going steady? GRACE (GUILTY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not funny. I feel terrible-- the poor kid's spending all his hard-earned money on me--that's sad. Cute, but sad. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, you should be flattered. You're thirty-eight-years-old and college kids are still swooning over you. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I just feel bad if I gave him the wrong impression.
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrong impression? What makes you think that--I mean, besides the flowers, I.D. bracelet, and love letter? Maggie picks up a card. MAGGIE (CONT'D) (READING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Dearest Grace--Our final game is tonight. Please meet me at the coach's place afterwards to celebrate. Yours truly, Gerry.' GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for piling on. Grace stands up and SIGHS. GRACE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I can't accept this. I guess I'm just gonna have to go set him straight. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Fred are sitting at a table sharing a pizza whil Fred texts someone. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just texting Missy Frankenfield that we're going to be at Enter the Dragon--I'm covering all my bases. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need Missy Frankenfield tonight. If we can't get the job done with Coakley as our wingman, then we're pathetic. Just then, Fred NOTICES something O.S. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, here come da man! CLOSE ON RESTAURANT ENTRANCE - a suave, DEBONAIR MAN (pla by George Clooney) comes through the doors and stops to c out the room. Rick and Fred jump up and approach him WITH OPEN ARMS but the last second Clooney steps aside REVEALING a THIN, BAL MAN dressed HEAD-TO-TOE IN MOTORCYCLE LEATHERS (think Lar David.) FRED & RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coakley!
COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My two favorite nutsuckers--how the hell are ya?! The three men hug, then Coakley nods toward Clooney. COAKLEY CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See who just walke ( in here in front of me? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, who? COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Clooney. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing here? COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know--must be shooting a movie or something. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Look, man, we've got a situation on our hands. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, Baker filled me in. S'been rough sledding, huh? Coakley puts his arms around the two guys. COAKLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't worry, my little snickerdicks...Coakley's here. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mass of BEAUTIFUL GIRLS and SLICK GUYS vie for position outside this CROWDED CLUB. REVERSE ANGLE REVEALS Rick, Fred and Coakley watching fro across the street. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need three-hundred bucks. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? Coakley shoots him a look. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're really serious about this, stop questioning me. The guys look at each other, then reluctantly COUGH UP TH DOUGH. With money in hand, Coakley marches confidently across the street followed by Fred and Rick. When the SLI BOUNCER sees them approaching, he PARTS THE CROWD.
SLICK BOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Coakley. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up, my guy? Coakley PASSES ON THE MONEY with a handshake and the Boun UNHOOKS THE VELVET ROPE. Then Coakley smiles back at Fred and Rick. COAKLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push the defrost button on the microwave, boys. The deep freeze is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coakley leads them into the club. Rick and Fred can't believe all the BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE around them. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, guys, you tried it your way and you railed miserably. You struck out, you were oh-for- everything. So now we do it my way, which is... The guys look at Coakley like Richard Gere looks at the D Lama. COAKLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . Go ugly early. Rick and Fred are visibly deflated. COAKLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, you're not trying to get married here--you're trying to get laid. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you the guy who goes to the Hawaiian Tropic finals every year? Is that for the ugly girls? COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go to the Tropic finals because Miss North Dakota's gonna lose and she's gonna need a hug. And quite often you can parlay a hug into a hand-job. Rick, you're up--get us two bottles of Moet and six glasses. Rick shoots Fred a look, then weaves his way through a sc of PEOPLE up to the bar. He tries to flag down a bartende but can't get anyone's attention.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Mills. Rick turns to see that he's crammed in beside his babysit Paige who's looking a LITTLE TIPSY.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Paige. What are you doing here? She pulls out her license and holds it up. PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I turned twenty-one yesterday. (DRUNKEN SMILE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm legal now. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, happy birthday. You out celebrating? PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm here with my Aunt Meg. Paige points across the club to AUNT MEG, a striking redh early 40's, who's talking to a couple of YOUNG MEN. PAIGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the best. Forty-two years old but she still parties like she's my age. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Rick continues to try to get the bartender's attention. PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Rick, how's the hall pass going? Paige smirks at Rick who shrinks a little. PAIGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind if I call you Rick, do you? I am officially an adult now. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course not--what did you just say? PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was asking about your hall pass. (off Rick's look) I baby-sit for the Putneys and I heard Gary talking about it the other night at their barbecue. Rick REACTS to this. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was talking about it at a barbecue?! PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he wasn't saying it in a bad way.     85 PAIGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, I thought it was very classy of you to be staying at the Holiday Inn Express instead of bringing girls back to your home with all the kids' pictures and schoolwork taped up everywhere. Rick forces a smile. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. A male BARTENDER, 25, finally appears in front of Rick. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, um, two bottles of Moet and six glasses please. Paige eyes Rick as she sips her drink. PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So does it work both ways? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall pass. Does your wife get one, too. RICK (AMUSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no, no. A hall pass is for men only. PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Who made that rule? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ...um... As Rick thinks about this, Paige moves in tighter. PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I kind of owe you an apology. (lowers her voice, BASH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week ful) when you drove me home, I shouldn't have snapped at you like that. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't worry about it. It was a big misunderstanding. PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't. She takes a moment, looks around.
PAIGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you thought I was coming on to you that night, it's because...I was. Rick flinches at this. Just then the Bartender returns wi the champagne. Rick fumbles through his pocket and finall pays. Then he's left alone with Paige and her coed-in-lov with-the-professor eyes and her suddenly heaving cleavage RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Um...I have to go, Paige, but it was great seeing you. Paige grabs Rick's arm as he tries to go. She looks sudde annoyed. PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious? You're doing this again... even with a hall pass? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige, you're my kids' babysitter. Have a happy birthday. As Rick walks away, we go BACK ON COAKLEY AND FRED as Rick arrives with the champag COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go, bubbles doth floweth. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap... look who's here. The guys turn to see the coffee girl, Leigh, walking past with two of her GIRLFRIENDS. She sees them and LIGHTS UP. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rick! What happened yesterday-- I thought we were gonna grab a beer? Fred looks at Rick, confused. RICK (SHEEPISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got a little caught up in my curls and reps and shit. (CHANGING SUBJECT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is this your playground? LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I've never been here, but a friend of mine's DJ-ing tonight so I promised him I'd come. Just then Wannabe from the coffee shop swoo s in and give Leigh a kiss on the cheek. He has a pair of headphones hanging around his neck. WANNABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wassup, girl?
Wannabe NOTICES Rick and loses his smile. WANNABE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey. What are you doing here-- you auditing the place? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I work for Sirius XM Radio--we're looking to hire some new deejays so I'm checking out all the clubs. Wannabe stiffens, suddenly respectful. WANNABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Cool. Are you serious? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not! Leigh is amused by this, but she tries to hide it from th deflated Wannabe. WANNABE (ANNOYED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's hip. Real fresh. (turns to Leigh) Why don't you hit the dance floor-- the next song's gonna be for you. As Leigh's Girlfriends pull her onto the dance floor, Wan returns to his deejay booth. FRED (GLARING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer? When were you two going to have a beer? RICK (GUILTY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, Leigh and I just belong to the same gym and happened to be there at the same time yesterday afternoon. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gym do you belong to and where the hell was I? COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, according to Kimmy Long, you were at the massage parlor trying to get a rub-and-tug without filling out the paperwork. This takes the wind out of Fred's sails. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Coakley CHUCKLES and Rick glares at Fred.
RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the massage parlor was admitting defeat? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a knot in my neck--why the hell didn't you tell me you saw Coffee Girl?! COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, guys, cut the crap. We're all here for the same thing. And I'll give you a hint what that thing is: It begins with a 'P' and ends with an 'ussy.' Coakley puts his arm around Fred. COAKLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now relax, Fredd , everyone's gonna get taken care ot. (looks out at crowd) We Just gotta find you a gazelle with a bad wheel. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Coakley spots something. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh--there's a couple of trainwrecks. Let's go. FRED (ALARMED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa--wait a second. But Coakley steers Fred over to two CHUBBY, NOT-SO-ATTRAC BLONDES laying on a 'bed' in the corner. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies, this is my friend Fred Pinkberry--his yogurt company just went public and he's out celebrating. He'd like to offer you a flute of champagne. The Chubby Blondes PERK UP. CHUBBY BLONDE #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love Pinkberry! As the girls make room for a reluctant Fred, we go... BACK ACROSS THE ROOM where we see Rick watching Leigh and hot girlfriends DANCE. Leigh catches Rick staring. He smiles and clumsily shoots her the PEACE SIGN. Finally, h takes a deep breath and DANCES HIS WAY UP NEXT TO HER. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.. .having a good time?
LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chillin'. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Just chillin' and wigglin'. LONG BEAT as they dance. Then: RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been ancing in a long time. LEIGH (TEASING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Just try to keep up. She smiles at this, then Coakley DANCES UP BESIDE RICK an PULLS HIM ASIDE. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abort! Abort! You stand not a chance. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I think we're starting to gel. Coakley rolls his eyes. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, you're mistaken. Look, dude, this ain't Operation Cock- block here--now trust me, retreat. Rick glances back at Leigh, torn. She looks fantastic. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coak, I'm never gonna have another hall pass, so this memory has to last a lifetime. . .you know what I mean? Coakley looks at Leigh and SIGHS. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll be at the bar when this thing blows up in your face. As Rick dances back over to Leigh, we... PAN ACROSS THE ROOM to the PISSED-OFF Wannabe watching th from the deejay booth. WANNABE (INTO MIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, 'all, adult-swim's over. Now if you was born before 1980 you're gonna want to step off the floor 'cause we're about to kick it up.
ON RICK - he looks over at Wannabe but CONTINUES TO DANCE RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this guy your boyfriend or something? LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. She waves it off, then shrugs guiltily. LEIGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One time we messed around a little. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what does 'messed around a little' mean these days? LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anal. Rick tries hard to act nonchalant. LEIGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kidding. He kissed me one night and I kissed back--I shouldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: WANNABE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Seriously, you grandpappies better get off the floor before someone falls and breaks a hip! Rick points at Wannabe. RICK (CALLING BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just play your funky music, white boy! As the music shifts gears and becomes FASTER and LOUDER, CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie's at the sink cleaning up when she NOTICES that th ANSWERING MACHINE LIGHT IS BLINKING. She dries her hands, then pushes the button.

dialogues.speaker: HISPANIC WOMAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (on answering machine) Hola, Maggie, this is Isabel. I went to clean the house today but nobody has been there or slept in any of the beds this week, so I just cleaned the windows and left early. I hope you don't mind. CLOSE ON a concerned-looking Maggie. She moves to the window, stares at the lights on the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Maggie turns to see Rick Coleman standing out on her fron porch. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey. She goes to the screen door. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you might want to help me celebrate the end of the season. He holds up a grocery bag.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got some good late-night eats. Maggie hesitates a moment. Then she opens the door and le him in. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bored-looking Fred is smooshed between the Chubby Blond on the bed. CHUBBY BLONDE #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the greys--you know, the tall, skinny aliens--and they were all over my yard, but--and here's the weird thing--I wasn't at all afraid of them so when they asked me if I wanted to get in their spaceship, I said, 'Sure,' and I walked right on. CHUBBY BLONDE #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, you're so brave! I would never, ever in a million years climb into one of those things. Fred, would you ever just walk into a UFO on your own? FRED (DEADPAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they came right now I would, sure.

dialogues.speaker: MISSY FRANKENFIELD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: There you are! Fred looks up to see Missy Frankenfield approaching. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god! You're here! Fred jumps off the bed and gives Missy a hug.     92 FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franken-berry, how the heck are ya?! She returns the embrace, but not quite as tight. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look incredible! MISSY FRANKENFIELD (CLEARLY UNCOMFORTABLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Fred, you look good, too. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never felt better. Missy nods. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to say, I can't believe I'm actually here--I was on my way home from dinner when I noticed your text. So what's this big emergency? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, uh, yeah. By 'emergency' I just meant that there's some important stuff I want to talk to you about. You know, one on one, me and you--without all the husbands and wives and hoopla. So how are you? MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... good. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean how-are-you. Inside. What's happenin' in there? There must be all sorts of emotions churning up with the divorce and everything. She gives him a long look. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go somewhere else-- this doesn't seem like the best place to spill one's guts. Just then, Coakley swoops in and pulls Fred aside. COAKLEY (UNDER BREATH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part of 'go ugly early' didn't you understand? You've got a better chance of winning husband-of-the- year than tagging that chiquita. Fred flinches at this. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...I know her. She said she wants to leave with me.
COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she's insane--run for the hills. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coak, the woman's going through a divorce. She's not insane, she's just making really poor decisions right now. (hands him his car keys) Here, give Rick the keys to my mini- van. I'm gonna go back to the hotel with Missy. Coakley looks back at Missy and softens. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your funeral, princess. BACK ON RICK AND LEIGH dancing up a storm. Rick is OUT OF BREATH and SWEATING LIKE A PIG. His shirt is soaked and h hair is dripping wet. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay--you keep checking your pulse? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'm fine. I had a little chest cramp during the last song, but I worked through it. She smiles at this. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's sit this one out. I need a breather. They move to the bar and Rick starts DRYING HIMSELF with stack of cocktail napkins. LEIGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's up with the ring? He looks at his finger, then back at her. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...have you ever heard of a hall pass? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace pulls up in her Camry and gets out. She hears MUSIC coming from inside and hesitates a BEAT before walking nervously onto the porch and KNOCKING. A moment later Ger appears in the doorway. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is! Come on in, I'm mixing up some margaronis. We lost our final game, but I got four hits!
GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Great. Uh, where is everyone? GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all went out to party--now get in here! But Grace stays on the porch. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry, I'm sorry but I can't stay. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Grace hasn't been in this situation in a long time and it shows. Gerry steps out onto the porch looking concerned. GERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, everything's fine, but... (holds up gift box) .I can't accept this. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Grace does a double-take. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry, I'm a married woman. Gerry nods at this, maybe a little hurt. She hands him th box and he reluctantly accepts it. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... I'm sorry if I made you uncomfortable, Grace. It's just that...I really like you. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, too, Gerry, and you didn't make me uncomfortable. She smiles at him and he forces a smile back, and there's some serious eye-contact, and then BAM! They DIVE AT EACH OTHER and start SUCKING FACE LIKE THERE NO TOMORROW. As they continue to MAUL EACH OTHER, they STUMBLE INTO THE HOUSE, and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Leigh are leaning against the bar. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...you're married?     95 RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't deliberately hiding it. He holds up his ring hand. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just thought your wife had died or something and you were wearing it out of respect. RICK (UNCOMFORTABLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, nope. She's still hangin' in there. Just then, Coakley PULLS RICK ASIDE. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you're not gonna close the sale here--let's move this clambake back to my place. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but what am I gonna do there? COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, what are you gonna do? I've got a house with bedrooms--do the math. When it doesn't work out with her--which it won't--there's going to be a bunch of other back-up chicks there. Rick nods then turns to Leigh. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My buddy's inviting everybody back to his crib. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds cool. As they walk toward the exit, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Missy are walking down the hallway toward his ro MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to be honest, Fred... I'm not really sure what we're doing here. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? We're hangin', we're connecting--that's what friends do. Especially if they want to take it to the next level where they can call each other 'good friends.'
He comes to his room and starts to unlock the door. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're married, Fred. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, blah, blah, blah, blah. Fred opens the door but Missy stays in the hall. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does blah-blah mean? You are still married, right? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happily. Look, I don't want to get into all the details, but my wife gave me this one-time deal where I get to be with another woman. He opens the door wide. She looks at him for a BEAT. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were going to the hotel bar? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are. There's a mini-bar in my room. You better hurry up, it's last call. Fred smiles. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your flippin' mind? Fred loses the smile. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?! FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be honest with you-- your tone right now is scaring me. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call me up for the first time in your life, claim you have some kind of emergency, and it turns out that you just want to screw me?! FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or not. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, screw you, Fred! She starts walking down the hallway. Fred nods, unfazed.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nail on the head! She turns and glares at him. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you just said--I had that coming. Big time. Fred hangs his head. FRED (CONT'D) (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, Missy, I...I don't know what's gotten into me this week. I think I must be having some kind of mid-life crisis or something because I've been acting like a real jackass. (SIGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway ease forgive me. I really am very, very sorry and ashamed. Missy, standing a few feet away, finally calms down. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Whatever. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. LONG BEAT. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ... . you want to come in for that drink? He arches an eyebrow. MISSY FRANKENFIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Fred! Missy STORMS away. FRED (TO SELF )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'No thank you' would have sufficed. Fred walks into his room and closes the door. INT. RICK & FRED'S HOTEL ROOM - CONTINUOUS Fred goes to the mini-bar and pours himself a drink. He looks around the room. The week's over and he's failed miserably. He sits on the bed. Alone. Then a KNOCK. Fred gets up and opens the door.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. May I help you? REVERSE ANGLE REVEALS Paige's Aunt Meg. She's wearing a skirt and low-cut tank top and has cougar written all ove her. AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, my name's Meg. I'm your babysitter Paige's aunt, and I just wanted to come over here and tell you this: They don't make men like you anymore. She smiles. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, thank you. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to come in? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guilt-ridden Grace is just finishing GETTING DRESSED wh Gerry comes out of the bathroom buttoning up his shirt. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah. It's just ...no, everything's not okay. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He moves close to her and she grows uncomfortable. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're a great cguy, Gerry, and you're very charming and very sweet and the last thing I wanted to do was hurt your feelings, but...well, what,just happened can never happen again. Gerry looks confused. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's probably hard for you to understand but...I love my husband. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? What does that have to do with anything? Fate threw us together and we went with it--isn't that what life's all about?
Grace looks at him, recognizing the youth and triteness o his words. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not always. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't fair to my husband... and it wasn't fair to you because this could never become anything more than just.. .what it was. She looks at him and shrugs apologetically. Gerry BARKS o a LAUGH. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? GERRY (BIG SMILE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do. Jeez. I mean, no offense, but let's face it, you're a lot older than me. She flinches, a little embarrassed. A quick reality check for Grace. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean that in a bad way. I'm just saying, I didn't think we were going to start dating, you know? Could you imagine the looks we'd get? It'd be like Hugh Hefner and his girlfriends--except in reverse. Gerry CHUCKLES. GERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be Hugh Hefner. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got that part. Gerry looks at his watch. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, I gotta get going. We have kind of a team meeting in like twenty minutes. Gerry sees Grace glance at the clock: 12:15 A.M. GERRY CONT'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's, uh, kind o a tradition that we always get together on the night of the last game. It would probably be uncool if I missed it.
GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to explain. GERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, though, thanks for everything--that was awesome. He holds up his hand and she diligently HIGH-FIVES HIM. T Gerry WALKS OUT THE DOOR. Grace sits there alone for a moment. We PUSH IN ON HER and we hear Gerry's CAR START OUTSIDE, and when Grace STARTS TO CRY, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a Tudor home in an upscale Brookline neighborhood We can hear 'Rage Against The Machine' BLASTING from the street. There's thirty or so cars out front and PEOPLE ar still arriving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is JAMMING. It's a nice house but under-furnish in a bachelor pad kind of way. Rick and Leigh are in a corner drinking beers. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I still have a lot to get out of my system before I do the marriage trip. I'm one of those people who wants to try everything once before I die. RICK (BLURTING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been with a married guy? Leigh pauses, but she doesn't flinch. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither have I. Rick winces, but Leigh smiles at him. It's the moment of truth. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
