dialogues.text: I'd like to help you take being with a married guy off your list of things to do before you die. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Leigh gets close.
LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be a home-wrecker. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a one-time pass, remember? LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't just a line? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's for real. Leigh seems intrigued. She moves closer still, takes his hand. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where can we go to talk some more about this? RICK (NERVOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Coakley has a game room upstairs. We could.. .talk there.

dialogues.speaker: WANNABE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Leigh! Rick and Leigh look over to see an AGITATED Wannabe forci his way through the crowd. WANNABE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you...? Why didn't you...? You knew this was my big night! How could you just--? (turns away, emotional) Look, can I please talk to you in private? Now. Leigh looks apologetically at Rick. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me a second? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Wannabe and Leigh walk a few feet away and Rick watches t have an ANIMATED CONVERSATION. It appears Wannabe may eve be crying. Finally, Wannabe storms across the room but wh he gets to the door, he looks back at Leigh. WANNABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? Are you coming? Leigh SIGHS, then approaches Rick. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Rick. I have to go deal with this. Rick can't believe what's happening.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Now? I thought you said he wasn't your boyfriend. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not...but he is a friend. Leigh glances at the broken-down Wannabe standing there a the door, then turns back to Rick. LEIGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Before Rick can stop her, Leigh LEAVES THE PARTY with Wannabe. After a LONG BEAT, Rick slides down into a chair DEVASTATED. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie is spilling her guts to Rick Coleman as he stands the stove MAKING PANCAKES. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .And he hasn't even spent one night in his own bed this week. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight--you gave him his freedom and now you're mad that he's acting free? This logic clearly stings Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm sure there's an explanation. Maybe he took a trip somewhere? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called his assistant--he's been in the office almost everyday. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Maggie, for all you know your husband's been working at a sou kitchen, sleeping in his car al week, and he's only gotten laid two or three times at most. She looks up and forces a smile. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha-ha. Maggie checks her watch. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, I wonder what's taking Grace so long?
RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if she went over to break the kid's heart, the least she could do is lend a sympathetic ear. He flips a pancake onto a plate.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Prepare yourself for heaven. She reaches for the plate, but he slaps her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not so fast, lady. I'm not finished. You have not lived until you've had my steaming hot blueberry pancakes... He pulls a carton of vanilla ice cream out of a bag.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .A la mode. Maggie smiles. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh My-lanta. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to wash it all down... Rick reaches into the bag and pulls out a DESSERT WINE. O Maggie's smile, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glum Rick is walking through the PACKED PARTY when he b into Baker and Hog-Head standing around a keg with a GROU GUYS. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. . .what are you guys doing here? HOG-HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here for the hall pass. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I thought you guys had given up on us? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did. We're here with them. He nods toward RICK LEARY and WILLY BOSHANE, both early 4 and paunchy. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?
BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Leary and Boshane heard about your guy's hall pass, they convinced their wives to give them one, too. A smiling Leary tries to HIGH-FIVE Rick, but he's having of it. He turns to Baker, livid. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't supposed to tell anyone about the hall pass! LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't say anything. Our wives heard about it at the pool. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! At the pool?! Rick rubs his face, distressed. BOSHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. And then about three days ago-- after some hard-core negotiating-- we managed to push the bill through. The guys LAUGH. Rick can hardly believe what he's spawned RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? So...how's it going? BOSHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solid. Very solid. LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're building mucho momentumo. Baker makes a JERK-OFF MOTION. LEARY (CONT'D) (ANNOYED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Baker, a hall pass ain't just about sex, you know. BOSHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. It's about going bowling and, uh, staying up late, and being able to do what you want to do when you want to do it. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't gotten laid yet, huh? BOSHANE (DISPIRITED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lot tougher than we thought it would be. Just then Gary comes around a corner.
GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, dudes, there's like ten very bangable chicks out on the back deck--let's go! Leary HOLDS UP HIS BEER. LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To freedom! The guys TAP their beer cups, then EXIT toward the back d A dejected and defeated Rick watches them go, then turns pushes his way through the crowd to the front door. As he OPENS THE DOOR to leave, he finds himself FACE-TO-FACE WI LEIGH. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where are you going? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing...? I thought you'd left. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I told you, I just had to talk him off the ledge. I calmed him down and sent him on his way. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh, great. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's that game room? I thought we were gonna play some games. She smiles and takes his hand and as they walk away, we g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Leigh walk down the hall to the game room. He op the door and flips on the light. THEIR POV - there's a pool table, a few pinball machines, bar, and a bed. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back--I just have to use the bathroom. Rick nods, then watches as Leigh walks off and disappears into the bathroom. He takes a DEEP BREATH. This is it. Just then he hears O.S. LAUGHTER. Rick heads down the hallway and pushes open a door.

dialogues.speaker: COAKLEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. REVERSE ANGLE reveals Coakley SITTING ALL ALONE in a smal study off the hall. He has a bowl of Cap'n Crunch on his and is watching a re-run of The Andy Griffith Show.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How come you're not downstairs partying? Coakley gives him a sad, worn-out smile. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All partied out, pal. Rick nods, understanding. Coakley LAUGHS once again at th TV. COAKLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, that Barney Fife still kills me. He looks back to Rick. COAKLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I was thinking about this hall- pass business. It's really ironic, isn't it? Rick glances down the hall to see if Leigh has returned. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that? COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well think about it. There's two kinds of guys who cheat on their wives: The guy who does it behind her back, and a guy like you who has his wife's permission. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's not really cheating if I have permission. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever. The point is, if you asked a hundred people who the better CJuy is, ninety-nine of 'em would pick you, because you're being honest--there's no deceit involved. Rick is growing uncomfortable. COAKLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the funny thing is, the other guy, the cheater, the bad guy, he has to live with all that guilt and anxiety, while his wife's running around happy as a clam because she doesn't know anything. And you, the good guy, you've got no guilt at all because you just laid it all on your wife's shoulders. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I didn't really think of it LIKE--
COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like she's your guilt Sherpa! Coakley CHUCKLES and Rick deflates. COAKLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, huh? RICK (WEAKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. COAKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that, my friend, is why you are a genius. As Rick lets this all sink in, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RICK & FRED'S HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT Paige's Aunt Meg is sitting on the couch. Her legs are crossed revealing a lot of skin. Fred hands her a glass o wine and sits beside her. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers. They CLINK glasses. AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, I hope you don't mind me tracking you down--Paige told me where you were staying. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Not at all. AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been very sweet to her. Fred waves her off. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, she's a good kid. I do what I can for the kids. Aunt Meg moves in a little closer, squints at him sweetly AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me everything. And I have to say, I was very impressed. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm? AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know she tried to hook-up with you--twice in fact--and that you set her straight both times. Fred hadn't heard this from Rick and is a little confused
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...hook-up? AUNT MEG (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, enough with the chivalry. Paige wanted to sleep with you and you didn't take advantage of her. I'm just saying that's very cool. He shrugs modestly. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... she's a kid and kids get crushes. I remember in tenth grade I had the biggest crush on my French teacher--thank God Mr. LeClaire was professional enough to only date seniors. Meg GIGGLES. AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, it takes a certain kind of guy to say no to a beautiful young girl like that-- especially since you have your wi e's permission now. Meg shoots him a knowing smile and puts her glass down.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MEG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I like that, Rick. You have morals. She leans in and KISSES HIS NECK. Fred glances down at he breasts. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, all you have in this world is your word. As Aunt Meg CLIMBS ON TOP OF FRED, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick ENTERS to find Leigh playing a pinball machine. Leig turns and smiles at Rick. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh, I gotta split. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? RICK (NERVOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I kind of hit a wall. She can hardly believe her ears.
LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Are you feeling okay? You're not mad because I went outside with my friend, are you? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Look, I shouldn't be doing this. I have.. .you know, commitments. Leigh nods at this, then unties a shoulder strap and her DRESS FALLS TO THE FLOOR. Suddenly she's NAKED before him and she's PERFECT. RICK (CONT'D) (WEAKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, you dropped something. For a moment nobody moves. We can almost hear Rick's hear beat. Then Leigh STEPS CLOSER to him and Rick instinctive leans back. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. Don't think so much. You're gonna have your wife for the rest of your life, but tonight. . .you have me. Leigh smiles. And it's the kind of smile you only get two three times in your life, if you're lucky, and probably n from a woman this beautiful. She reaches down and UNBUCKLES HIS PANTS, then she PULLS HIS SHIRT. They stand face-to-face now, the middle-aged g and the young beauty, and it's happening exactly the way had hoped it would, the dream. She presses her body against his and STARTS TO KISS HIS N her hand DISAPPEARING SOMEWHERE BELOW HIS WAIST. Then she leans her head AGAINST HIS CHEST. As he looks down at her we PUSH IN on a suddenly conflicted Rick. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. I can't do this. He reaches for his shirt. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. She stares at him, confused, as he buckles his pants. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife didn't give you a hallway permission slip, did she?
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she did, but... look, you're insanely beautiful and pathologically sexy and every cell in my body is telling me to dust do this, but-- Rick points to his chest. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this area, this spot right here? The first time Maggie and I slept together, back in college, she fell asleep right here. And she left a puddle of drool. And it didn't bother me. It actually felt good. That's when I knew I was going to marry her. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when my kids--Emma and Gunnar-- when they were babies, this is where they slept. Or sometimes at four o'clock in the morning Emma would just lay there and stare up at me. It was where we first got to know each other. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm sorry, Leigh, but as amazing as I think you are...I gotta go home. Rick shrugs apologetically. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think you have a screw loose and you're probably going to regret this for the rest of your life, but. . .right on, man. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...do you want me to give you a ride home? LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's only one-thirty--I'm going back down to the party. Rick raises two fingers. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace it. LEIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R-O-C-K in the U-S-A. As they smile at each other one last time, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is pulling away from Coakley's house when the car ph RINGS. Rick pushes a button to ANSWER.     RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (ON SPEAKERPHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, is this Fred Searing? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, no, I'm sorry, he's not here right now. I'm using his car.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (ON SPEAKERPHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, would you know where I could find him? This is Sgt. Polisner of the Massachusetts State Police. As Rick grows alarmed, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RICK & FRED'S HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT Fred is still on the couch with Aunt Meg on the floor in front of him. Fred's PANTS ARE DOWN TO HIS ANKLES, leavin him with only his boxers on. Meg KISSES HIS CHEST and STOMACH, then leans back and TAKES OFF HER TANK-TOP, revealing EXTRA-LARGE BAZOOKAS stuffed into a slinky bra. AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm attracted to men with integrity. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks--wow, you got great jugs. Meg takes Fred's hand and leads him toward the bed (with pants still at his ankles), Fred WADDLING LIKE A PENGUIN. AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moral-guy's a tit-man, huh? FRED (SHRUGGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I grew up in the midwest. She pushes him down on the bed and Fred quickly kicks off pants and shoes (but keeps his boxers on.) Meg TACKLES hi and the two of them start to roll around UNDER THE COVERS An O.S. Fred seems to be working his way down her stomach AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes! Rick... please...I want you to make love to me. Just then Rick BURSTS INTO THE ROOM, out of breath. Fred Meg come up from under the covers. (Fred is at waist-leve her.) RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, I need to talk to you! Meg GLARES down at Fred, confused.
AUNT MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred? I thought you were Rick?! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Rick. Fred cowers guiltily. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't judge me. As Aunt Meg KARATE KICKS Fred in the face, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, now dressed, hurries across the parking lot with Ri on his heels. Fred has BLOOD-STAINED TISSUE stuffed up hi nose. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they tell you? Is Grace gonna be okay? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is she was in a car accident and they rushed her to the hospital. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... Suddenly they hear O.S. GLASS SHATTERING. They look up an REACT. THEIR POV - From fifty yards across the parking lot, they see that Fred's mini-van's windshield has just been BASHE by the BAT-WIELDING Wannabe. On the side of the vehicle i spray-painted: HORNY OLD MAN. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!!! What the hell...?! Wannabe turns to them, a CRAZED LOOK on his face. WANNABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like me now, Splenda- boy? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You moron, that's Lny car! His is the one next to it! Wannabe looks over at Rick's Avalon, PULLS OUT A KNIFE, a quickly SLASHES TWO OF RICK'S TIRES. As Rick and Fred RUN TOWARD HIM, Wannabe JUMPS INTO AN OLD BRONCO and PEELS OU THE PARKING LOT. BACK ON Rick and Fred as they slow down and CATCH THEIR BREATHS.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice job, Fred. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mini-van blows by a sign that reads 'CAPE COD - 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WINDSHIELD IS GONE and the wind blows back Rick and Fred's hair as if they were on a motorcycle. Fred tries h car phone as he drives. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on! How can a hospital not have a live operator?! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's four in the morning, Fred. Fred hangs up and pounds his steering wheel. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I thinking?! I had a great wife--a beautiful wife--and now I may lose her.. .because of you. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?! You said our wives were living their dreams, with their fancy gas ovens, and that our dream was the hall pass! How can you blame this on me?! FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never even heard of a hall pass until you flaunted yours in my face! 'Hey, look at me, I've got a hall pass--everyone should have a hall pass!' You ruined my life, Mills! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie and Rick Coleman sit on the back deck DRINKING WIN RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a great place. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my family's had it since I was a kid. We used to come for a week a summer, then two weeks, then a month, then by the time I got to high school we were living here all summer long.
RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong here, Maggie. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm? RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong with a guy who would leave a woman like you alone for this long. MAGGIE (UNCOMFORTABLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know...I did give him a hall pass. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? If you were my girl, I wouldn't have taken it. An awkward moment. Rick touches her hand and Maggie looks away.

dialogues.speaker: RICK COLEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You deserve way better. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, in Rick's defense, he didn't really even want the hall pass. I kind of forced it on him. RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do that? Maggie thinks about this. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I felt like he wasn't noticing me anymore. j guess I wanted to feel.. .desired again. And the truth is, in my heart, I never thought he'd go through with it. He brushes her hair from her face and they look into each other's eyes. He leans in and she does, too, and right wh it looks like THEY MAY KISS, Maggie hesitates as suddenly EVERYTHING BECOMES CLEAR TO HER. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... RICK COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hall pass ...it wasn't for him. (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was...for me. And as they hang on that realization, we CUT TO:     115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police cruiser is parked on the highway divider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two YOUNG COPS are relaxing with their coffees when the SMASHED-UP MINI-VAN FLIES BY. COP #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that? He didn't have a windshield. Cop #2 throws the car into drive and they pull a U-ey and GIVE CHASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred looks regretful. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, man, I shouldn't have blamed you for this. I'm the one who dragged you into this thing. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you didn't. I went willingly. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been bad, Rick. I've been real bad. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've both been bad. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been worse. I kissed your babysitter's aunt. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not so bad. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the vagina. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh. They hear a SIREN and Rick looks back to see the cops on their tail. RICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battered MINI-VAN blows by the 'WELCOME TO CAPE COD' hedges with the cop car on their tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred isn't slowing down. He grows more determined.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over, man! FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, I can out-run 'em! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you can't--not in this thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see another POLICE CRUISER FISHTAIL OUT OF A SIDE STRE and JOIN THE CHASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, now there's two of 'em! FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care--I'm not stopping 'til we get there! RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?! FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm crazy! I'm crazy about my wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Fred come SKIDDING UP to the EMERGENCY ROOM ENTR in the graffitied mini-van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Young Cops SCREECH to a stop behind the mini-van the second cruiser flies up behind them. COP #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on! The officers spring from their cars and quickly TACKLE Fr as he runs toward the front doors. Rick climbs out of the passenger seat with HIS HANDS RAISED. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear me out, gentlemen, I can explain everything! A BURLY OFFICER from the back-up car form-tackles Rick, BLASTING him backwards onto the sidewalk. Fred and Rick manage to roll away and then CRAWL THROUGH FRONT ENTRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys barely get in the door before being PUMMELED TO FLOOR by the four cops. The TWO PEOPLE seated in the wait room STAND UP IN SHOCK and then a swarm of DOCTORS and ORDERLIES come running in to see what the commotion is.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace needs me! Cop #1 PINS FRED'S HEAD TO THE FLOOR as Cop #2 lays acros his legs. COP #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just take it easy, buddy. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I won't take it easy! Look, I'm sorry I was speeding and I shouldn't have run from you guys, but my wife's been in an accident and she's in this emergency room and I gotta see how she is because... (GROWS EMOTIONAL)

dialogues.speaker: .THAT WOMAN'S MY WHOLE LIFE
dialogues.text: The cops look moved and unsure what to do. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the husband of... (glances down at chart) .Grace Searing? Fred strains to look up. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Is she okay?! The Doctor hesitates and the cops look at each other and the Burly Officer releases Rick from his head-lock. BURLY OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let him up. The young officers get off Fred and help him up. Fred rus to the Doctor, who seems very serious. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me she's gonna be okay. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is. Your wife broke her nose and she got shaken up a bit, but all in all she's a very lucky woman. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that wrong, doc. I'm the lucky one. Fred is visibly relieved as the doctor smiles and walks o FRED (CONT'D) (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless you, doctor! Fred turns to Rick and the two men hug and then Rick grab Fred by the shoulders and looks him in the eye.
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take care of that woman, buddy, and I'm gonna go home and take care of mine. Fred nods, emotional, as the cops look at each other, unmoved. Rick starts to walk away. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick... Rick stops and turns at the door. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go love that lady! The Burly Officer rolls his eyes and steps up to Rick. BURLY OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, before you 'go love that lady', we're going to have to write you guys up. As the officer pulls out his CITATION PAD, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick pulls up in the wrecked mini-van and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick steps quietly into the house. He sees two empty bott of wine and two half-filled glasses on the coffee table. Then he hears Maggie's O.S. VOICE coming from the bedroom

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh my god...oh my god...oh my and... ON RICK - he looks concerned as he approaches the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick ENTERS to find Maggie laying in bed... TALKING ON TH PHONE. MAGGIE (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god... oh my god, you poor thing. Maggie looks up, shocked to see Rick. MAGGIE (CONT'D) (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Rick just walked in. (TO RICK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace was in a car accident!
RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. She's okay. Maggie goes back to the phone. MAGGIE (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they let you go? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... so you're on your way? Great. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too, honey. She hangs up. MAGGIE CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, she scared ( me to death. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March twenty-fifth, 1988. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day I lost my virginity. March 25th, 1988 at approximately ten- thirty in the evening. Maggie thinks about this. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We were dating then. Rick nods. She looks at him, not sure if she understands. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were my first. And you were my last. And you were everything in between. As it all sinks in, Maggie STARTS TO WELL UP. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...is that why you were crying that first night? Rick shrugs, embarrassed. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was...I was your last? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my only. Forever.
Maggie smiles and runs into his arms. They KISS, and it's real kiss, the kind they haven't had in a long while. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Law & Order MUSIC CUE as we SUPER: DAY 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is lightening but the sun hasn't risen yet. A tax van pulls up and Fred gets out. (Fred has a BLACK EYE.) H helps Grace out of the van, then pays the DRIVER. (Grace TWO BLACK EYES and her nose is HEAVILY BANDAGED.) When th taxi drives off, Fred helps Grace toward the house. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .And what were you doing driving around at one o'clock in the morning? GRACE (NERVOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I was upset so I went for a drive--you know, to think--and I must have hit a patch of sand, and before I knew it I was into the pole. Fred stops and looks her in the eye. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Grace. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For putting you through all this. Grace looks awash in guilt. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault, Fred. FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is--of course it's my fault. This isn't you--driving around all night, thinking--you're not a thinker. When she looks up at him, he forces a smile. But she does smile back. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Fred, we have to talk about... about what happened this week. Fred takes a DEEP BREATH and looks around, trying to avoi the moment.
FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace. . .do we really have to do this? Grace lowers her head guiltily. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah, we do. When she looks back up, she NOTICES the SPRAY-PAINTED and BATTERED MINI-VAN. GRACE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horny old man? FRED (MATTER-OF-FACT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, honey, that's not me--they were talking about Rick. Grace looks at him, confused. Suddenly Fred falls to his knees. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, all you gotta know is that whatever happened doesn't matter! I love you and only you! And I'm going to treat you like the queen that you are for the rest of your living days, so help me God! I'll mow the lawn, I'll shovel the snow, I'll wash the stubble off the sink... Grace looks down at him. FRED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .But please, I'm begging you, sweetie... can we please just never talk about what happened this week? Grace's eyes flicker about, hardly believing her luck. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...deal. Fred gets up and THROWS HIS ARMS AROUND HIS WIFE. GRACE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Fred. As they embrace, Fred sees Rick come out the front door w his arm around Maggie. Fred shoots Rick a THUMBS-UP. CLOSE ON RICK AND MAGGIE as they smile at Fred and Grace. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you two! We're gonna go watch the sun come up!
Hall & Oates's 'When The Morning Comes' begins to pla our two HAPPY COUPLES hold hands and walk off toward the beach, we pull up, up, up, and... FADE OUT: THE END
